question_sets.context: The "big day" has arrived for Agnes. She is finally leaving the hospital after a long illness. Her husband, Clark, is pushing her in a wheelchair. They say good-bye to the nurses as they pass by on their way to the hospital. Agnes was ill for more than six weeks. The doctors were not sure about her illness. At first they thought that she needed an operation(手术). Finally, after many tests, the doctors gave her some new medicine. Now, she is nearly well.

questions.text: The story took place in the hospital.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Agnes leaving the hospital, indicating the story takes place there.

questions.text: Agnes was ill for over six weeks.
questions.explanation: The passage states Agnes was ill for more than six weeks.

questions.text: At first the doctors thought they should operate on her.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions doctors initially considering an operation.

questions.text: After an operation, the doctors gave her some new medicine.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates medicine was given after tests, not an operation.

questions.text: Agnes is OK now.
questions.explanation: The passage says Agnes is nearly well, implying she's OK.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Inference Skills

question_sets.context:
Betty,
I hope you're well. I'm on holiday in London with my friend Jenny. We arrived by plane last Monday and took a taxi to our hotel. I went for a walk in Hyde Park but Jenny didn't come with me because she was tired.
Then on Tuesday we saw the clock, Big Ben, and Buckingham Palace. Queen Elizabeth lives in the Palace, but we didn't see her! I bought some presents but Jenny didn't buy anything!
The next day we visited the British Museum and had dinner in a Chinese restaurant!
On Thursday morning we relaxed. Then we went to Tower Bridge on the River Thames and looked at the city. It's very big!
Finally today I did some shopping and Jenny listened to a concert in the park. I came back to the hotel and read the newspaper. Then I wrote some postcards and sent some emails. I took lots of photos and I'm sending them with this e-mail to you!
Tomorrow we're going to fly home. It was a short holiday, but it was great! Say hello to Mum and Dad.
Love,
Gran

questions.text: They arrived in London last Sunday.
questions.explanation: The passage states they arrived last Monday, not Sunday.

questions.text: On Wednesday they saw Big Ben and Buckingham Palace.
questions.explanation: The passage states they saw Big Ben and Buckingham Palace on Tuesday.

questions.text: On Thursday they saw the River Thames and visited Tower Bridge.
questions.explanation: The passage confirms that they saw the River Thames and visited Tower Bridge on Thursday.

questions.text: Today they spent the day at the hotel.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates Gran did some shopping and Jenny listened to a concert, so they did not spend the whole day at the hotel.

questions.text: Gran did some shopping on Friday.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'Finally today I did some shopping', and 'today' refers to Friday.

question_sets.context: A good breakfast is important. You can easily understand it. By breakfast time you have not eaten anything about twelve hours. Your body needs food for morning activities(活动). One good breakfast should be rice or bread, an egg , milk and fruit. On a cold morning a cup of hot drinks is necessary(必需的). A good breakfast helps you to smile more easily. It helps you to be more friendly and also to work better and play more happily. Your whole day will be more fun after you have enjoyed a good breakfast.

questions.text: It's not very important to have a good breakfast.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states 'A good breakfast is important.' Therefore, the statement is false.

questions.text: Food is needed in the morning because you have had nothing to eat for the whole night.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'By breakfast time you have not eaten anything about twelve hours.'

questions.text: Only rice or bread will be a good breakfast.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'One good breakfast should be rice or bread, an egg, milk and fruit.'

questions.text: If you get up late, you will not eat your breakfast.
questions.explanation: The passage does not mention anything about what happen if you get up late. So this statement might not be true.

questions.text: A good breakfast is helpful to you.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates, 'A good breakfast helps you to smile more easily...to work better and play more happily.'

question_sets.context: Liu Xiang is a famous runner in the world. He was the winner(获胜者) of the Athens Olympics(雅典奥运会) . The Chinese people are proud (自豪) of him. He is a hard-working young man. He is still strong and healthy. Why is he in good health? He usually gets up early in the morning and exercises every day. He likes listening to music and he sings well. He has good eating habits. He never eats junk food and hardly ever smokes and drinks. He goes to bed early and sleeps 8 hours every night. He often says, "It is important(重要) for health to have a good lifestyle."

questions.text: Liu Xiang is a singer.
questions.explanation: Liu Xiang is a famous runner.

questions.text: He never wins the Olympics.
questions.explanation: He was the winner of the Athens Olympics.

questions.text: He doesn't have a healthy eating habit.
questions.explanation: He has good eating habits.

questions.text: He likes singing and smoking very much.
questions.explanation: He never smokes.

questions.text: He has enough (足够的) sleep and he is healthy.
questions.explanation: He sleeps 8 hours every night.

question_sets.context:
My name is Qing Min. I'm a middle-school school. I am studying in No. 1 Middle school. My school isn't big, but I like it very much.
In my school there are eighteen classes. There are about fifty students in every class. We have twenty-seven teachers. I'm in Class 4, Grade 2. In my classroom there are twenty-six desks and fifty-two chairs. There's a map of China and a map of the world(世界)on the wall. My classroom is big and clean.
There are twenty-eight boys and twenty-four girls in my class. We have English, Chinese, maths and five other subjects(学科). Every morning some of as come to school by bus. Some get to school by bike, but sometimes I come to school on foot. My English teacher often says, Please be careful(小心)when (当……时)you come to school by bike. He is a good teacher. We like him very much.
I love my school, because(因为)our teachers are very friendly to us. We must study hard(努力)for the people.

questions.text: I like my school because it's No 1Middle School.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the author likes the school, but the reason is not because it is No. 1 Middle School, but because the teachers are friendly.

questions.text: There are fifty-two students in Class 4, Grade 2.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions "There are twenty-eight boys and twenty-four girls in my class", which adds up to 52.

questions.text: There are two maps on the wall of Class 4, Grade 2.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that there is "a map of China and a map of the world on the wall".

questions.text: I have ten subjects at school.
questions.explanation: The passage says "We have English, Chinese, maths and five other subjects", which means a total of 8 subjects.

questions.text: All the students walk to school.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions "Every morning some of as come to school by bus. Some get to school by bike, but sometimes I come to school on foot."

question_sets.context: There are three photos of my good friends on my desk. In the first photo you can see Jerry. He is a tall and cool boy with short and straight hair. He is the captain of our basketball team. He is very popular. All my classmates like him very much. In the second photo, you can see the boy with glasses. His name is Jack. He is short and a little bit heavy. But he is very smart and funny. He often tells us funny stories and makes us happy. In the third photo, you can see two girls. They are drinking water. The girl on the left is Lucy. She is a beautiful girl from London. She has long blond hair and big eyes. She can sing very well, and she can also speak a little Chinese. The girl on the right is Li Xiaoyun. She is a Chinese girl with beautiful black hair. She studies very hard. She says she wants to be a scientist when she grows up.

questions.text: Jerry, Jack, Lucy and Li Xiaoyun are all my good friends.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that all of them are good friends of the writer.

questions.text: The boy with glasses has short and straight hair.
questions.explanation: The passage says the boy with glasses is Jack, and Jerry has short and straight hair.

questions.text: Lucy is an English girl.
questions.explanation: The passage says Lucy is from London.

questions.text: Jerry plays basketball very well.
questions.explanation: The passage says he is the captain of the basketball team.

questions.text: The girl on the right of the third photo is Lucy.
questions.explanation: The passage says the girl on the right is Li Xiaoyun.

question_sets.context:
Bill: What are you reading?
Mike: A book about UFO.
Bill: Really? Are there real UFOs in our life?
Mike: Well, some of the UFO stories may be true. The universe is so big and there are millions of stars in it. Perhaps there are living things in outer space. They may be cleverer than us and they are trying to visit us. Have you read the report about UFOs that flew over Beijing, Wuhan, and Hangzhou?
Bill: Oh, yes. And I've also read some other reports about the UFOs.
Mike: What do you think of UFOs.
Bill: It's hard to say. I am not sure.

questions.text: Mike is reading a newspaper about UFOs.
questions.explanation: Mike is reading a book, not a newspaper.

questions.text: Mike thinks there are real UFOs.
questions.explanation: Mike believes some UFO stories may be true.

questions.text: Some reports say the UFOs flew over Beijing.
questions.explanation: The dialogue mentions reports of UFOs flying over Beijing.

questions.text: Bill didn't read reports about UFOs.
questions.explanation: Bill says he has read some other reports about UFOs.

questions.text: Bill knows a lot about UFOs.
questions.explanation: Bill is unsure about UFOs, indicating he doesn't know a lot.

question_sets.context:
Whales(鲸) are the biggest animals in the sea. They are much bigger than any animals on land. The largest whales are more than 30 meters long.
Whales live in water, but they are not fish. They have warm blood and they breathe air through a hole in the top of their head. They can stay under water for about an hour without breathing (不呼吸).
There are two kinds of whales. One kind has a big mouth with teeth. Its mouth measures four meters in depth. It can eat other larger animals of the sea. This kind is called a killer whale.
The other kind of whale is much larger than the killer whale. It has no teeth. Instead, it has rows of bones(骨头) in its mouth. Small sea life is caught in these bones. These whales also have a very small throat. They cannot swallow anything larger than an apple.

questions.text: Whales are the biggest animals in the sea, but they are not <blank> .
questions.explanation: According to the passage, 'Whales live in water, but they are not fish.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Whales have a <blank> in the top of their head. They breathe through it.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, 'They breathe air through a hole in the top of their head.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Killer whales have large <blank> . They can eat other large animals in the sea.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, 'One kind has a big mouth with teeth...It can eat other larger animals of the sea. This kind is called a killer whale.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Instead of teeth, large whales have <blank> in their mouths. They live on the small sea lives.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, 'Instead, it has rows of bones(骨头) in its mouth. Small sea life is caught in these bones.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Whales are much larger than <blank> on land.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, 'They are much bigger than any animals on land.'
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

question_sets.context:
An old porter (搬运工)had been working for the railway for a very long time. He was standing in one of the big railway station in London one morning, waiting for travelers(旅行者)to ask him to help them with their luggage(行李)when he saw a small man running toward the trains, carrying a bag.
The porter watched the man for a few seconds, and then the man saw the porter. At once he ran up to him and said,"Can I catch the 10:35 train to Newcastle--on―Tyne, porter?" He was breathing (呼吸) very fast, and he looked worried.
The old porter looked at him for a moment and then said politely(有礼貌地),"Well, sir, I'd like to help you, but I can't answer your question, because I don't know how fast you can run along rails, you see, "he explained(解释), "the 10:35 train to Newcastle―on―Tyne left five minutes ago."

questions.text: The small man was not a porter. He was a passenger.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates the small man asked the porter for help, implying he was a passenger.

questions.text: The small man was running because he was carrying a heavy bag.
questions.explanation: The passage states the small man was carrying a bag and running, but it doesn't explicitly say he was running because of the bag's weight.

questions.text: The passenger wanted to go to Newcastle-on-Tyne.
questions.explanation: The small man asked if he could catch the train to Newcastle-on-Tyne, indicating his destination.

questions.text: The old porter knew that the small man could not catch the train.
questions.explanation: The porter stated that the train had already left, so he knew the man couldn't catch it.

questions.text: The small man go to the station at twenty to eleven.
questions.explanation: The 10:35 train had left five minutes ago, meaning the small man arrived at 10:40, not 10:40

question_sets.context:
After supper Mr. Jackson turned on the television． He tried to find a football game on it． At that time the telephone rang and he went to answer it．"Hello,"he said, "．" "It's Betty speaking," said a woman． "Henry is ill． And I have to take him to hospital． But Lucy is too young…""Don't worry． I'll go and look after her． But where's your husband James�t" "He's gone to London． He'll be back at two tomorrow morning．"
Mrs. Jackson was on duty in the hospital that night and Mr. Jackson had to go to help his sister．Lucy was only four．She began to cry when her mother left．Mr. Jackson told her some stories, taught her a song and showed her some nice pictures． He didn't stop until the little girl went to sleep．Mr．Jackson went home after James came back． He was asleep soon after he went to bed． His wife came into the bedroom and it woke him up． He had a look at the clock on the wall and found it was half past eight．He jumped off the bed and ran to the_garage_(车库) with his bag． His wife tried to say something, but he called back,"I was never late for work, you know． But I'm late this morning．" "No, you aren't," said Mrs. Jackson． "It's Saturday．"

questions.text: On what day did Betty call Mr. Jackson?
questions.explanation: Mr. Jackson woke up on Saturday, so Betty called him on Friday.

questions.text: Why did Betty ask for Mr. Jackson's help?
questions.answer: Because she had to take Henry to hospital and she couldn't leave Lucy at home by herself．
questions.explanation: Henry is ill． And I have to take him to hospital． But Lucy is too young…

questions.text: What did Mr. Jackson do to make Lucy stop crying?
questions.answer: He told her some stories, taught her a song and showed her some nice pictures．
questions.explanation: Mr. Jackson told her some stories, taught her a song and showed her some nice pictures．

questions.text: Why did Mr. Jackson run to the garage when he woke up?
questions.answer: Because he thought he was late for work．
questions.explanation: He jumped off the bed and ran to the_garage_(车库) with his bag． His wife tried to say something, but he called back,"I was never late for work, you know． But I'm late this morning．"

questions.text: How many people have_been mentioned_(被提到)in this passage ?
questions.explanation: Mr. Jackson, Betty, Henry, Lucy, Mrs. Jackson, James.

question_sets.context: I am a Chinese student. Last year, I went to England. I got to London at ten in the evening. I was tired and wanted to find a place to have a good rest. Of course, I didn't know the way. I saw an English man in front of me. I went over to him and asked him to tell me the way. I spoke to the man in English. I spoke slowly, but the man couldn't understand me. I asked the question again and again, at last he understood. He answered my question, but I couldn't understand him. The man and I looked at each other and laughed. Then he said something and I understood, "You will learn English here, won't you?"he said.

questions.text: The student studied English, but he couldn't use it well.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the student spoke slowly but the man couldn't understand, indicating difficulty in practical English usage.

questions.text: The student arrived in London very late that day.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that they looked at each other and laughed, indicating a friendly interaction, not anger.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Tone & Attitude

questions.text: The English man thought that the student should learn English in England.
questions.explanation: The English man said, "You will learn English here, won't you?"

question_sets.context:
Jim, with his father, goes to see his grandfather. In the train Jim often puts his head out of the window. His father says, "Jim! Don't put your head out of the window!" But Jim goes on putting his head out of the window.
Now his father takes Jim's cap quietly, hides(藏) it behind his back and says, "You see your cap is gone(不见了)." Jim is afraid.
His father says, "Well, whistle(吹口哨) once. Perhaps your cap will come back." Jim whistles. His father quickly puts the cap on Jim's head.
"Oh! It is wonderful!" Jim laughs. He quickly takes his father's cap and throws it out of the window. "Now it is your turn(轮到你啦) to whistle, Dad!" he says happily.

questions.text: Jim and his father go to see his grandfather by bus.
questions.explanation: The passage says they go by train, not by bus.

questions.text: Jim's father tells him not to put his head out of the window.
questions.explanation: Jim's father says "Don't put your head out of the window!"

questions.text: Jim's father takes Jim's cap and hides it behind his back.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states this action.

questions.text: Jim doesn't want to have his cap back.
questions.explanation: Jim is afraid when his father says his cap is gone.

questions.text: Jim takes his father's cap and throws it out of the window.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Jim throws his father's cap out the window.

question_sets.context: A man has a cat. He likes her very much. At mealtime the cat sits at the table with him. The man eats with a knife and a fork, but the cat eats from her plate. Sometimes, when she finishes her dish, her master will give her a bit of his food. He shares his meal with her. One day the cat is not at the table at mealtime. "Ah! Where is my cat?" asks the man. His wife says, "Can't you eat without her?" So the meal begins without the cat. Before lunch is over, the cat rushes into the room and jumps into the chair quickly. She has two mice in her mouth, and before anyone can stop her, she drops(扔下) one into her own plate, and the other into her master's plate. "Dear me!" cries the woman, "A mouse is in your plate!" "Hush(安静)!" says her husband. "This shows that she is a nice cat. She knows what friendship(友谊) is. She wishes me to share her dinner as I often share mine with her.

questions.text: The master loves his cat very much.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the man likes his cat very much.

questions.text: The cat always shares her food with her master.
questions.explanation: The passage describes the master sharing his food with the cat, but not the other way around, until the end.

questions.text: One day the cat is not at the table at mealtime.
questions.explanation: The passage states that one day the cat is not at the table at mealtime.

questions.text: The cat hurries(匆忙) home with two mice in her mouth when the master and his wife are having lunch.
questions.explanation: The passage states that before lunch is over, the cat rushes into the room with two mice in her mouth.

questions.text: The story tells us the cat also loves her master.
questions.explanation: The master's interpretation of the cat's actions suggests the cat cares about him.

question_sets.context: A student is interviewing a scientist. Let's listen to their talking. The student: May I have some questions about robots to you? The scientist: Certainly. I'm very glad to talk about robots with you. The student: Do you think there will be robots in people's homes? The scientist: Sure. They will help us do much housework. The student: When will robots help us in the homes? The scientist: We won't see robots able to work around the house for 50 to 100 years. The student: Why will it take us so long time? The scientist: Partly it will be because of the cost. The robots are too dear. The student: Where are the people using robots now? The scientist: In some hospitals, people use robots to carry meals or drugs and people also use them to do some easy things have to be repeated again and again. The student: I think robots just don't get bored, so they can do some easy things again and again. The scientist: That's it! Robots will give us more help about our future life. The student: That's great! Thank you very much.

questions.text: There will be robots in people's homes.
questions.explanation: The scientist says 'Sure. They will help us do much housework.'

questions.text: Robots are cheap now.
questions.explanation: The scientist says 'Partly it will be because of the cost. The robots are too dear.'

questions.text: The scientist predicts robots won't help us do much housework for 50 to 100 years.
questions.explanation: The scientist says 'We won't see robots able to work around the house for 50 to 100 years.'

questions.text: Robots can't carry meals or drugs in some hospitals now.
questions.explanation: The scientist says 'In some hospitals, people use robots to carry meals or drugs...'

questions.text: Robots can do some easy things again and again because they don't get bored.
questions.explanation: The student says 'I think robots just don't get bored, so they can do some easy things again and again.'

question_sets.context:
When people go to England, they must learn something about transportation there.
In England, cars, buses and bikes must keep to the left side of the street. If a person wishes to cross a street, he must stop and either look at the traffic lights or look both ways down the street. And instead of looking left first, as we do in China, they look right first.
To get about in London, visitors should learn to use buses and the subways. First of all they must know which direction(方向) they are going to and which bus and which subway they must take. At the bus stop they wait for buses to come. As soon as they get on the bus, they must pay for their tickets.

questions.text: In England, people go along the left side of the road , we do in China, too.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, people in England go along the left side of the road, but people in China go along the right side of the road.

questions.text: When they want to cross a street, people in England look right first.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, when they want to cross a street, people in England look right first.

questions.text: To go about in London, visitors should learn to drive.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, to go about in London, visitors should learn to use buses and the subways.

questions.text: First of all, visitors must know where to go.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, first of all, visitors must know which direction they are going to.

questions.text: After people get on a bus, they don't have to pay for their tickets at once.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, after people get on a bus, they must pay for their tickets at once.

question_sets.context: A man was walking in the park with his dog. Then he saw his friend with a dog. The two began talking and the dogs ran off together (一起). After a few minutes they became (变得) worried(焦虑). "I want to know where Hannibal is." he said. "I want to know where Cleopatro is." she said.They went to look for their dogs, but they couldn't find them.Three days later the man telephoned (打电话) his friend. "Did your dog come home?" he said. "Yes." she answered. "How did you find it?" "I put an advertisement (广告) in the newspaper and I got it back the next day. Why don't you try (试) that?" "I can't put an advertisement in the newspaper." he said. "Why not?" "Because Hannibal can't read."

questions.text: Two friends and their dogs met in the street.
questions.explanation: The two friends and their dogs met in the park, not in the street.

questions.text: The two friends talked together and their dogs ran off together.
questions.explanation: The two friends talked together and their dogs ran off together.

questions.text: A few minutes later they became worried because they couldn't see their dogs.
questions.explanation: A few minutes later they became worried because they couldn't see their dogs.

questions.text: The woman's dog could read but the man's dog couldn't.
questions.explanation: The man said his dog couldn't read, not necessarily the woman's dog could read.

question_sets.context:
Do you know there are many kinds of grass? Some are tall. The kind that grows around your house is short grass. But field grass often grows as tall as a man.
Some food that we eat comes from plants of the grass family. Wheat(小麦)and rice are two of them. We use wheat to make bread. We use both wheat and rice to make breakfast. At some places, people eat more rice than any other food.
Animals as well as people get food from the grass family. Cows eat hay (干草). Do you know the kind of grass that horses like to eat?

questions.text: Wheat and rice belong to the grass family.
questions.explanation: Wheat and rice belong to the grass family.

questions.text: We use rice to make bread.
questions.explanation: We use wheat to make bread.

questions.text: Horses don't get food from the grass family.
questions.explanation: Animals as well as people get food from the grass family.

questions.text: Cows only eat hay to live every day.
questions.explanation: Cows eat hay (干草).

questions.text: The grass family are all short.
questions.explanation: The grass family are not all short.

question_sets.context: A man was trying to build an electric motorcar. He worked in an office in the town during most or the week, but on Saturdays and Sundays he stayed at home in the country and worked on his electric car. Every Monday he told his friends at the office about his work on the car, but his news about it was never very good. Then at last, one Monday morning he came to the office and said to his friends, "I have done it! I have driven from my home to here by electricity!" His friends were all very glad. "How much did it cost to get here by electricity?" they asked. "Three hundred and two pounds," he answered, "Two pounds for the electricity, and three hundred pounds for the electric wires from my house to the car."

questions.text: The man spent 6 days in the town and one day in the country every week.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions the man worked in the town during most of the week (more than 1 day), and stayed at home in the country on Saturdays and Sundays. Thus, this statement is false.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: Sometimes he worked on his electric car in his office.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the man worked on his electric car at home in the country on Saturdays and Sundays, not in his office. Therefore, this statement is false.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: It cost him 302 pounds to build an electric car.
questions.explanation: The passage states that it cost him 302 pounds for one trip, including the electricity and the electric wires from his house to the office, not to build the whole car. Thus, this statement is false.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: One Monday morning he drove in the electric car from his home to the office.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly mentions, "Then at last, one Monday morning he came to the office and said to his friends, 'I have done it! I have driven from my home to here by electricity!'" This indicates the statement is true.

question_sets.context:
Dear Carolyn,
I'd love to see you next week, but I'm very busy. I'm stressed out! I have to study for my English test on Monday night. I'm going to the dentist on Tuesday, and you have to see the doctor on Wednesday, My mother's having a party on Friday, and I have to help her with that. What are you doing on Thursday? I'm not busy that day. Are you working in the afternoon? Can we talk on the phone or listen to CDs? Call me!            Your friend,
David

questions.explanation: The passage states that David has to study for his English test on Monday night.

questions.text: David has to see the dentist on Thursday.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions David going to the dentist on Tuesday, not Thursday.

questions.text: Carolyn is busy on Wednesday.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'you have to see the doctor on Wednesday', referring to Carolyn.

questions.text: Carolyn has to help her mother on Friday.
questions.explanation: David has to help his mother on Friday, not Carolyn.

questions.text: David and Carolyn are busy on Thursday.
questions.explanation: David says he's not busy on Thursday, and the passage doesn't specify Carolyn's schedule.

question_sets.context:
The Hope ProjectEducation plays an important part in modern life. However, in some poor areas, many children can't afford the expenses of schooling (付学费)and are forced(被迫) to leave school. At the same time, our country is not able to invest (投资)too much in it. Under this condition,the Hope Project is necessary to our country. Firstly, it will create conditions(创造条件) for the children to go back to school. Secondly, it can make more people educated. So it can lead to the improvement of people's standards(标准) of life.
In my opinion, the Hope Project is of great importance to our country, I hope that with this help more and more children can get the opportunity (机会)to be educated.

questions.text: Education doesn't play an important part in modern life.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage indicates that Education plays an important part in modern life.

questions.text: In some poor areas, a few children can't afford the expenses of schooling.
questions.explanation: The second sentence of the passage indicates that many children can't afford the expenses of schooling.

questions.text: Our country is not able to invest (投资)too much in it.
questions.explanation: The third sentence of the passage indicates that our country is not able to invest too much in it.

questions.text: Our country will create conditions(创造条件) for the children to go back to school by itself(靠自己).
questions.explanation: The fourth sentence of the passage indicates that the Hope Project will create conditions for the children to go back to school.

questions.text: More and more children will go to school.
questions.explanation: The last sentence implies with the help of hope project more and more children will get opportunity to be educated

question_sets.context:
A city is a very big place. Sometimes it' s a lonely place, too. There are thousands of people in a city, but some of them don' t have any friends.
How about you? Do you have a lot of friends? If you don' t, make friends today. If you do, make another friend today.
Pick a stranger at your job or school. Walk up to him or her and say,"Hello. My name' s....What' s your name?" Start with a conversation(谈话).Smile, listen carefully, and show interest in your new friend' s answers. Ask "Where are you from?" and "Do you like this city?" That' s a good way to start.

questions.text: A city is a very big and noisy and lonely place.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that a city is a very big place. Sometimes it's a lonely place, too.

questions.text: Everyone in the city has many friends.
questions.explanation: The passage states that some people in the city don't have any friends.

questions.text: The paragraph tells us not to make friends in a city.
questions.explanation: The paragraph encourages making friends in the city.

questions.text: When you wanted to make friends with someone, please say at first,"What' s your name? How old are you?"
questions.explanation: The paragraph suggests to ask 'What's your name?' but doesn't mention asking about age.

questions.text: It' s a good thing to make friends with others.
questions.explanation: The passage promotes making friends with others.

question_sets.context:
Dear Tom,
I have a day off today. Now let me tell you something about Beijing. In our country people drive cars on the left side of the road, but here in Beijing, on the right side. Many people of London go to work by car, while most people of Beijing go to work by bike. The weather of Beijing is better than ours. It's fine for long here, but we have so many cloudy days in London．Students here work hard at their lessons and a lot of people can speak English. It's a pity that students in our country don't work hard and few people know Chinese. That's all for today. Please write to me soon．
Your ever,
Peter

questions.text: This letter is from an English boy to his friend Tom.
questions.explanation: The letter is signed 'Peter,' and he compares London and Beijing, implying he's from London/England.

questions.text: Peter is a farmer, not a student.
questions.explanation: Peter compares students in Beijing to those in 'our country,' suggesting he is also a student or someone involved in education.

questions.text: Tom may be a middle school student in London.
questions.explanation: Given Peter's comparisons and location in London, it's a reasonable inference that Tom is also a student there.

questions.text: In England cars go along the road on the right side.
questions.explanation: The letter states that in 'our country' (implied to be England), cars drive on the left side of the road.

questions.text: Peter thinks the Chinese students work harder than English students.
questions.explanation: Peter explicitly says 'Students here work hard at their lessons' and that 'students in our country don't work hard'.

question_sets.context:
Ⅳ．Reading.
Jack lived in a small town in England. He always stayed in England for his holidays, but last year he thought, "I've never been to other countries. All my friends go to Spain, and they like it very much, so this year I'm going there, too. " So he got on a plane to Spain and arrived at the airport of the capital, Madrid, and stayed in a hotel for a few days. On the first morning he went out for a walk. In England people drive on the left, but in Spain they drive on the right. Jack forgot about this, and while he was walking on a busy street, a bicycle knocked him down.
Jack lay on the ground for a few minutes and then he sat up and said, "Where am I? "
Just then an old man selling maps went past him. When he heard Jack's words, he said to him at once, "Maps of the city, sir? "

questions.text: Jack had never spent his holiday in a foreign country before he went to Spain.
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'he had never been to other countries'.

questions.text: Jack had many friends in Spain.
questions.explanation: The passage only mentions his friends go to Spain, but not that he has friends in Spain.

questions.text: Jack wanted to visit Spain because his friends invited him to go there.
questions.explanation: The passage states he went to Spain because his friends liked it, not because they invited him.

questions.text: Jack's first stop was Madrid and he stayed there for more than one month.
questions.explanation: He stayed in a hotel for a few days, not more than one month.

questions.text: The traffic rules in England are different from those in Spain.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'In England people drive on the left, but in Spain they drive on the right'.

questions.text: It was Jack's fault when he was knocked down.
questions.explanation: He forgot the traffic rule, so it was his fault.

questions.text: A man riding a bicycle knocked into Jack when he was walking in a busy street.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'a bicycle knocked him down'.

questions.text: Jack was badly hurt and lay on the ground for a long time.
questions.explanation: He lay on the ground for a few minutes.

questions.text: Jack didn't mean to buy a map of Madrid when he said "Where am I? ".
questions.explanation: He was disoriented and asking for his location, not intending to buy a map.

questions.text: The old man wanted to sell a map of Madrid to Jack.
questions.explanation: The old man was selling maps and offered one to Jack.

question_sets.context: Many people like animals. Children like animals best. Usually we can only see dogs, cats, ducks, or chickens. We can't see other animals such as elephants, tigers, pandas, and monkeys. On Sundays, parents often take their children to the zoo. How happy the children are! They run from one place to another. They give animals all kinds of good food to eat. They stay there for long hours. They don't want to go home. Children always have a good home.

questions.text: Parents like animals best.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, children like animals best.

questions.text: Usually we can only see dogs.
questions.explanation: The passage says we can see dogs, cats, ducks, or chickens.

questions.text: Children are happy to go to the zoo.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'How happy the children are!'

questions.text: Children often stay long hours in the zoo.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'They stay there for long hours.'

questions.text: Children don't want to go home because they want to get back(取回) their food from the animals.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'They don't want to go home.' but not because they want to get back their food.

question_sets.context: People travel to work in different ways. Some people go to work on foot because they live near their work places. Some people go to work by bike because they live farther away, or they like riding bikes. They think it's good for their health. Today more people have private (私人的) cars, so they can go to work in their cars. In the south of China, many people even go to work by boat because water is around their houses. Will people go to work by plane? I think so, if necessary(如果必要的话).

questions.text: All people like to go work by bike.
questions.explanation: The answer is F, false.

questions.text: Some people think it's good to go to work by bike.
questions.explanation: The answer is T, true.

questions.text: Today more people drive to work.
questions.explanation: The answer is T, true.

questions.explanation: The answer is F, false.

questions.text: The writer thinks some people will go to work by plane if necessary.
questions.explanation: The answer is T, true.

question_sets.context: In 2008, many visitors are coming to China for the Olympic Games. I can tell them how to get around Beijing. I want to tell them it is easy to use public transportation here. They can travel by bus. And visitors can also take the subway trains. It's not difficult, because the trains usually come every 5 minutes all day long. I want to study English very hard so I can talk to visitors when they come to China.

questions.explanation: The writer wants to study English.

question_sets.context:
Have you ever seen the filmTraveling Bird? In the film, groups of birds fly high above the sky and cross the way above snow, rivers, fields, sea and grassland. I'm sure you will love the beautiful picture when you see the film.
But you may not feel so good if you have learnt aboutbird flu(禽流感) from TV or on the Internet. Some governments had to kill chickens in their cities. A large number of chickens and even some people died in Asia, and nearly 8,500 birds died in Russia because of bird flu.
Chickens can get bird flu from thefeces(粪便) of the passing birds. It is not so difficult tocontrol(控制) the chickens in cages or on farms. But it is much more difficult to control the birds in the sky.
Luckily, scientists have found a medicine for bird flu. But thevirus(病毒) can change easily and quickly. So bird flu is still a serious problem we must face.

questions.text: We know how birds get bird flu from the filmTraveling Bird.
questions.explanation: The answer is F. We know how birds get bird flu from the filmTraveling Bird. But we learn bird flu from TV or the Internet.

questions.text: Not only birds and chickens but also man can get bird flu.
questions.explanation: The answer is T. Not only birds and chickens but also man can get bird flu. A large number of chickens and even some people died in Asia, and nearly 8,500 birds died in Russia because of bird flu.

questions.text: The feces of the passing birds can not cause bird flu.
questions.explanation: The answer is F. The feces of the passing birds can not cause bird flu. Chickens can get bird flu from the feces(粪便) of the passing birds.

questions.text: It is easier to control chickens than to control flying birds.
questions.explanation: The answer is T. It is easier to control chickens than to control flying birds. But it is much more difficult to control the birds in the sky.

questions.text: Scientists have found the medicine, so we needn't worry about bird flu any more.
questions.explanation: The answer is F. Scientists have found the medicine, so we needn't worry about bird flu any more. But the virus(病毒) can change easily and quickly. So bird flu is still a serious problem we must face.

question_sets.context:
Mark Twain is traveling to Dijon (第戎) by train. He wants to sleep very much, so he asks the conductor(服务员)to wake him up when the train gets to Dijon. Then he goes to sleep. Later, when wakes up, it is early the next morning and the train has got to Paris. He knows at once(立即)that the conductor doesn't wake him up at Dijon. He is very angry. He runs up to the conductor and says, "Why didn't you wake me up and put me off the train at Dijon? I am very angry about it!"
The conductor smiles and looks at him, "Another American is angrier than you. But you can't see him now. I put him off the train at Dijon last night."

questions.text: Mark Twain asks the conductor to wake him up in Paris.
questions.explanation: Mark Twain asks the conductor to wake him up in Dijon, not Paris.

questions.text: The train got to Dijon at night.
questions.explanation: The conductor mentions putting another American off the train at Dijon 'last night'.

questions.text: Mark Twain was very angry with the conductor.
questions.explanation: Mark Twain explicitly states that he is very angry.

questions.text: The conductor made a mistake(错误). He put another American off the train at Dijon.
questions.explanation: The conductor admits to putting another American off the train at Dijon.

questions.text: Mark Twain can't see that American because the American doesn't like him.
questions.explanation: Mark Twain can't see the other American because the conductor put him off the train in Dijon.

question_sets.context:
Dick is seven years old and begins to go to school this autumn. He studies and listens to his teachers. He is polite(有礼貌) and has a few friends. They all like him.
It's Saturday today. Dick, his sister Kate and his mother stay at home. His mother is doing some housework and he's watching TV and the girl is doing her homework. At ten his father comes back with a bag of apples. The boy likes them very much, and wants to eat some. His mother gives him four apples and says, "Go to wash them in the kitchen(厨房)"
Dick washes the apples and gives them to his mother. The woman says, "Which apple do you want, Dick?"
"The biggest one, Mummy."
"What?" says Dick's mother. "You should be polite and pick the little one."
"Should I tell a lie(撒谎)just to be polite, Mummy?"

questions.text: Dick is in Grade Two.
questions.explanation: Dick is just starting school, so he is in Grade One.

questions.text: His mother is not at home today.
questions.explanation: The passage states that his mother is at home.

questions.text: His father gets home with a bag of apples.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly mentions the father returning with apples.

questions.text: Kate washes the apples.
questions.explanation: Dick washes the apples.

questions.text: Dick wants the biggest apple.
questions.explanation: Dick states that he wants the biggest apple.

question_sets.context: I'm a Chinese boy. My name's Li Lei. I study at a middle school in Beijing. I'm i n Class 3, Grade 1. There are forty-nine students in my class. Two of us are Ame ricans. Their names are Lucy and Lily. They are twins. They speak English. Their family stay in a house near our school. They go to school on foot(步行). We are  good friends. They teach me English. And I teach them Chinese. Now they can spe ak good Chinese. They often say China is great. They like Chinese food and like China very much.

question_sets.context:
A young man couldn't sleep well every night. He was very worried. One day he went to see the doctor. The doctor looked him over carefully. But nothing wrong with him. The doctor told him to count from 1 to 10 again and again. "Keep doing it until you fall asleep," the doctor said.
After a few days, the young man came to the doctor again. But to his surprise, the doctor found the young man was even worse than before! "Didn't you count as I told you?" the doctor asked. "Yes, I did," the young man answered. "But every time when I reached eight, I couldn't help jumping from bed."
"But why?" the doctor wanted to know. The young man said, "I am a boxer."(拳击运动员)

questions.text: The young man had to go to see a doctor because _______________________
questions.answer: he couldn't sleep well every night.
questions.explanation: The answer is directly stated in the first sentence of the passage.

questions.text: Was there anything wrong with the young man? ________________________
questions.answer: No, nothing wrong with the young man.
questions.explanation: The doctor examined him carefully but found nothing wrong.

questions.text: The doctor told the young man to_ count from 1 to 10 again and again._
questions.answer: count from 1 to 10 again and again.
questions.explanation: The doctor advised him to count to help him fall asleep.

questions.text: The young man came to the doctor again because_he was even worse than before!_
questions.answer: he was even worse than before!
questions.explanation: The text states that the doctor found the young man was even worse than before.

questions.text: What is the young man?_He is a boxer._
questions.explanation: The last sentence reveals that the young man is a boxer.

question_sets.context: Can animals be made to work for us ? Some scientists think that one day animals may be taught to do a number of simple jobs .They say that in a film or on TV we may see elephants ,or monkeys ,dogs ,bears or other animals doing a lot of things .If you watch carefully ,you may find that those animals are always given something to eat in return for doing them .The scientists say that many different animals may be taught to do a number of simple jobs if they know they will get something to eat in return .Of course ,as we know , dogs, can be used to guard a house ,and elephant can be used to do some heavy jobs .And we can also teach animals to work in factories . Apes (猿) ,for example ,have been used in America to help cars and scientists believe that these large monkeys may one day get in crops(收割庄稼) and even drive trains.Judge the following sentences true (T) or false (F) according to the passage you read.

questions.text: Many animals can be made to work for us some day .
questions.explanation: According to the passage, some scientists believe that animals may be taught to do simple jobs in the future.

questions.text: Some elephants ,monkeys ,dogs, bears or other animals in the film do many things because they know they will get something to eat after doing them .
questions.explanation: The passage states that animals are often given something to eat in return for doing things.

questions.text: Many different animals may be taught to speak ,read and write English ,too .
questions.explanation: The passage only mentions teaching animals to do simple jobs, not to speak, read, or write English.

questions.text: Dogs and monkeys can be trained to do a lot for people more easily because they are cleverer than others .
questions.explanation: The passage does not state that dogs and monkeys are cleverer than other animals.

questions.text: Some animals have been taught to work easy job in some factories .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that apes have been used in America to help in factories.

question_sets.context: John liked to wear his hair very long. Some of his friends thought that he looked like a girl, but they never made jokes about it, because John was big and strong. John always went to the barber's twice a month to have hair cut and washed, and one day the barber said to him, "Now why don't you let me cut most of this hair off and make your head tidy?" Nobody would recognize (认出) you if I did that. I'm sure," John said nothing for a few seconds and then he said, "maybe you are right, but I'm sure that nobody would recognize you either if you did that to my hair."

questions.text: John is a young girl.
questions.explanation: The passage states that John was big and strong, implying he is not a girl.

questions.text: His friends thought his hair was beautiful.
questions.explanation: The passage says some of his friends thought he looked like a girl, not that his hair was beautiful.

questions.text: John liked to have long hair.
questions.explanation: The passage states that John liked to wear his hair very long.

questions.text: John thought the barber was right.
questions.explanation: John didn't fully agree with the barber, as he made a joke in return.

questions.text: John was going to cut the barber's hair off too if the barber cut his hair off.
questions.explanation: John made a joke, implying he would make the barber unrecognizable too, but not necessarily cut his hair.

question_sets.context:
One morning mother came from her office, she looked at Tom's coat and said: "Look at your coat, Tom. It's too dirty. You must clean it now."
"Oh, mother, but I clean it only yesterday," said the boy. "It's dirty now. You must clean it again." answered his mother.
"No, I don't want to clean it today. If I clean it today, it will be dirty again tomorrow. Tom's mother thought for a moment and said: "OK. Don't clean it!"
In the evening, Tom was back from school. He was very hungry. So he said to his mother: "Give me something to eat,Mum.""You had your breakfast in the morning and you had lunch at school." said his mother. "But I'm hungry again." cried the boy."Hurry! But if I give you something to eat, you will be hungry again."

questions.text: Tom cleaned his dirty coat carefully．
questions.explanation: 文章中并没有提到Tom仔细地清洗了他的脏外套。

questions.text: Tom didn't think his coat was dirty.
questions.explanation: Tom认为他的外套是干净的，因为他昨天才洗过。

questions.text: Tom ate his lunch at school.
questions.explanation: 文中提到Tom在学校吃了午饭。

questions.text: Tom felt hungry that evening.
questions.explanation: 文中提到Tom那天晚上感到饿了。

questions.text: Tom's father was told to give Tom nothing to eat for supper.
questions.explanation: 文中提到的是Tom的妈妈，而不是Tom的爸爸。

question_sets.context:
One day a rich man met Fred. The rich man asked, "I heard you are very clever and nothing is difficult to you. Can you tell me why you are so clever?"
Fred said with a smile, "I'm not clever. Instead you are very stupid." The rich man got angry.
Fred said, "Don't be angry, please. If you don't believe what I said, now let me ask you a question. If you have a group, I give you another group of sheep, then how many groups of sheep do you have?"
"Why! That's the easiest question in the world. One and one is two. Anybody knows that. I have two groups of sheep."
Fred laughed and said, "You're wrong. Two groups of sheep put together is still one group. That's the easiest question in the world!"

questions.text: The rich man is much cleverer than Fred.
questions.explanation: Fred shows his cleverness, and the rich man is stupid.

questions.text: The rich man didn't think he was clever.
questions.explanation: The rich man think he is clever.

questions.text: "STUPID" means foolish.
questions.explanation: The meaning is right.

questions.text: In life, sometimes one and one is still one.
questions.explanation: In some situation, the meaning is right.

questions.text: Fred's answer is wrong.
questions.explanation: His answer is right.

question_sets.context:

I'd love to see you next week, but I'm very busy. I'm stressed out! I have to study for my English test on Monday night. I'm going to the dentist on Tuesday, and you have to see the dentist on Wednesday. My mother's having a party on Friday, so I have to help her with that. What are you doing on Thursday? I'm not busy that day. Are you working in the afternoon? Can we talk on the phone or listen to CDs? Call me!
Your friend,

question_sets.context:
Helen: Er… Can I go bowling with some friends tomorrow?
Dad: Which friends are going?
Helen: Oh, just Jenny and Kelly from my class… and Patrick.
Jack: Patrick? Is this a date, Helen? Ooh!
Helen: Shut up, Jack!
Mum: Jack, you mustn't ask questions like that. It isn't polite.
Dad: When do you want to go?
Helen: From two o'clock to five. It's the West End Bowl, in the center of town. I can walk there.
Dad: What do you think, Mary?
Mum: I think it's OK.
Dad: All right. You can go, but you must be home by teatime. Don't be late.
Helen: Sure.
Mum: And you must take an anorak.
Helen: Oh, Mum! Anoraks are for wimps!
Mum: Take an anorak. You can carry it in your bag.

questions.text: What does this word "shut up" mean?
questions.explanation: "Shut up" is an impolite way of saying "stop talking".
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Inference Skills

questions.text: What does Helen want to do?
questions.answer: She wants to go bowling with some friends.
questions.explanation: Helen asks her dad, 'Can I go bowling with some friends tomorrow?'

questions.text: Who is going?
questions.answer: Her classmates, Jenny, Kelly and Patrick.
questions.explanation: Helen mentions that Jenny, Kelly and Patrick are going.

questions.text: Where are they going bowling?
questions.answer: They are going to the West End Bowl.
questions.explanation: Helen says, 'It's the West End Bowl, in the center of town.'

questions.text: Does Helen want to take an anorak?
questions.explanation: Helen replies 'Oh, Mum! Anoraks are for wimps!'

question_sets.context:
Tom Lee is bored. He doesn't have anything to do. His sister, Linh, is at a football game. Mr Lee is at a friend's house. Tom doesn't feel like watching TV or listening to recorders.
The phone rings. It's his friend, Louis. "What are you doing, Tom?" "Nothing! Just wasting time," says Tom.
"Why don't we go over to James' house for a while?" Louis asks. "OK, but let's go over there later. Why don't we go to a movie first?"
"That's a good idea, Tom."
Tom looks in the newspaper to find out what movies are playing in town. Tom looks at the index to find the movie page.
Tom turns to page 41 because movies are a kind of entertainment. "Let's go to see Space Battle. I hear it's great!" Tom says.
"Where is the movie playing?" Louis wants to know.
"At the Park side Theater."
"That's an expensive theater, Tom. I don't have a lot of money. And it's not close to my house."
Tom says, "Why don't we see Guns at Noon at the Town Theater? It's an old movie so it's cheap and the theater is not far from your house."
"That sounds good to me. Why don't you pick me up first? Then we'll stop for James," says Louis.

question_sets.context:
In the southeast of China, people living near the sea believe that a typhoon comes because the sea is angry with them. They also believe in a kind goodness called Mazu, who they think can protect them on the sea, especially when a typhoon comes.
Typhoon have been given different names for several hundred years. They are now also named after girl's names, boy's names and names of flowers and so on. You may think it is funny to connect a beautiful flower with such a terrible thing, since there is nothing pretty about the typhoon itself.
Typhoon Rananim attacked China's southeast coastal regions(沿海地区) since 12 August, 2004 and killed over 100 people. Sarcastically(讽刺的是), the name Rananim means "hello" in the local language spoken in Micronesia(密克罗尼西亚). In fact, typhoon are quite destructive(破坏性的). It is quite usual that when a typhoon comes, hundreds of people may die and even more get hurt. During that time, the storm's strong wind and heavy rain may destroy(毁坏) farmland and killed livestock(牲畜). What is worse, the area attacked by the typhoon may lose its power supply, and millions of people may live without water or telephone service for some time.

questions.text: Typhoons always have some different beautiful names.
questions.explanation: The passage says typhoons are named after different names, including girl's names, boy's names and names of flowers.

questions.text: The typhoon attacked southeast part of China in August, 2004 is named "hello".
questions.explanation: The name Rananim means "hello".

questions.explanation: People believe Mazu can protect them.

questions.text: When the typhoon comes, there is a strong wind and heavy rain.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that during a typhoon, there is strong wind and heavy rain.

questions.text: Typhoon is a kind of natural disaster.
questions.explanation: The passage describes the destructive nature of typhoons.

The mother begins to speak, but the conductor stops her and the boy says, "I'm four years old at home and two and half in buses and trains."

question_sets.context:
Gregory spent his 114thbirthday and some reporters visited him to find out the secret of his long life.
"The secret of a long life is happiness,"Gregory said. "If you are happy, you will live long ."
"Are you married(已婚的)?"A reporter asked."Yes,"Gregory answered."I married my third wife when I was 102. If you are happily married, you will live better."
"What about smoking and drinking?"Another reporter asked."Yes they are important,"Gregory said,"Don't smoke at all and you will feel better. Drink two glasses of wine a day and you will be healthy and happy."

question_sets.context: You want to know about life in the past. Right! I can tell you. When I was a boy, things were different. I had to get up at six every morning. That was not very bad in summer, but in winter it was cold. And we didn't have any hot water in the house. We had to wash in cold water. We didn't have a bathroom . My dad had some chickens. I had to feed them every morning and then I had to walk to school with my little sister. It was about two miles to school and about two miles back in the evening. But it always seemed longer in the morning when we were going to school. There was a bus, but we didn't have any money. And we had to go to bed at eleven o'clock every night because I had too much homework and housework to do. We couldn't watch TV because there wasn't any. On Sundays we had to go to church three times �C morning, afternoon and evening. And we couldn't play outside on Sundays. But it wasn't all bad. We had some good times . We could go out and our parents didn't have to worry about us. There weren't so many cars on the roads then, so the streets were safe to play in. And there were not many robbers and thieves in those days. We had to work hard and we weren't able to buy all those things in the shops today. Life was hard, but it was simple and people were happier. I don't think I'd like to be young today.

questions.text: The writer usually went to bed at nine every night.
questions.explanation: The text states that the writer had to go to bed at eleven o'clock every night, so the statement is false.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: The write walked about four miles every day.
questions.explanation: The text says it was about two miles to school and about two miles back in the evening, totaling four miles, so the statement is true.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: Every morning the writer had to feed his chickens.
questions.explanation: The text states that the writer had to feed the chickens every morning, so the statement is true.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: The writer had a poor but happy family.

questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Implicit Information

questions.text: The writer and his sister never had any good times.
questions.explanation: The text mentions that it wasn't all bad and that they had some good times, so the statement is false.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
Mr. Smith lives in a small village, but he works in a big city. He goes to work by train every morning and comes home in the same way.
This morning when he was reading his newspaper in the train, a man behind him said "Hello!" to him and began to talk to him. "Your life is not interesting, is it? You take the same train at the same time every morning, and you always sit in the same seat and read the same newspaper" "How do you know all that about me?" Mr Smith was very angry, "Because I always sit in the same seat behind you." The man answered.

question_sets.context:
A young man couldn't sleep well every night. He was very worried. One day he went to see the doctor. The doctor looked him over carefully. But nothing wrong with him. The doctor told him to count from 1 to 10 again and again. "Keep doing it until you fall asleep," the doctor said.
After a few days, the young man came to the doctor again. But to his surprise, the doctor found the young man was even worse than before! "Didn't you count as I told you?" the doctor asked. "Yes, I did," the young man answered. "But every time when I reached eight, I couldn't help jumping from bed."
"But why?" the doctor wanted to know. The young man said, "I am a boxer."(拳击运动员)

questions.text: The young man had to go to see a doctor because he couldn't sleep well every night.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that the young man couldn't sleep well every night.

questions.text: Was there anything wrong with the young man? No, nothing wrong with the young man.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the doctor found nothing wrong with him.

questions.text: The doctor told the young man to count from 1 to 10 again and again.
questions.explanation: The doctor's advice was for the young man to count from 1 to 10 repeatedly.

questions.text: The young man came to the doctor again because he was even worse than before!
questions.explanation: The passage mentions the young man returned as he felt even worse.

questions.text: What is the young man? He is a boxer.
questions.explanation: The young man revealed he is a boxer.

question_sets.context:
A lift is very useful. It looks like a small room. It goes up and down all day. Sometimes a worker stands in the lift. He or she operates(操作) it up and down. In modern lifts there's no worker. People walk in. They know what floor they want to go. They push a button(按钮)and the lift goes to that floor. It's very fast and easy.
Lifts are very important to us. Why? Think about a tall building. Maybe it has twenty floors. Maybe it has fifty or more. Who can walk up all the stairs(楼梯)?Maybe people can climb them once. Can someone climb thirty floors to an office every day? Can small children walk up to their rooms on the twenty-four floor? Can their mothers or fathers carry food up to all those stairs? Of course not. We can have very high buildings because we have lifts. We could not have all the beautiful tall buildings without lifts. Because it is too tired for people to climb the stairs every day.

questions.answer: It looks like a small room .

questions.answer: He or she operates it up and down.

questions.text: Can small children walk up to their room on the twenty-four floor?
Why do we have many high buildings?
questions.answer: We can have very high buildings because we have lifts.

questions.text: Can you give a title for the passage?

question_sets.context: A good breakfast is important. It is not hard to understand. You have had nothing to eat for about twelve hours all the night. Your body needs food for morning activities. One good breakfast should be rice or bread, an egg, milk and fruit. On a cold morning, a cup of hot drink is necessary. You must get up early to have enough(足够的)time to eat breakfast. A good breakfast helps you to be more healthy and also to work better and play more happily. All your day will be more fun after you have a good breakfast.

Education plays an important part in modern life. However, in some poor areas, many children can't afford the expenses of schooling (付学费)and are forced(被迫) to leave school. In my opinion, the Hope Project is of great importance to our country, I hope that with this help more and more children can get the opportunity (机会)to be educated.

The conductor looks at the small boy for a few seconds and then says to him, "How old are you, young man?"
The mother begins speaking,but the conductor stops her and turns to the boy.The boy says, "I'm four years old,but my mother says I am two and a half in buses and trains."

question_sets.context: Three things are necessary for us to keep alive (活的). They are air, water and food. We eat food two or three times every day. We breathe (呼吸) air continually (不断地) day and night. If a man does not eat and food, he can live for about three weeks; if he is stopped from drinking, he can keep alive for about three days, but if he doesn't breathe, he can keep alive for only about three minutes. So we see that breathing is more important than drinking, and drinking is more important than eating.

questions.text: We can't live without air, water and food.

questions.text: A man can keep alive for about twenty-one days if he has water to drink and air to breathe.

questions.explanation: He can live for about three days if he is stopped from drinking.

questions.text: If he is stopped from breathing, He'll die in a moment.
questions.explanation: He can keep alive for only about three minutes if he doesn't breathe.

questions.text: Food is the least important of the three.
questions.explanation: Breathing is more important than drinking, and drinking is more important than eating.
