question_sets.context:
Joan goes to school at seven in the morning. Now she is waiting for the bus with her friends."The bus is coming," says Joan.
The big old school bus is stopping at the bus stop. The boys and girls are getting on. They go to school by bus. They get off the bus and go into the school.
After school, Joan looks for their bus. But their bus isn't there now. She sees a new bus but not theirs. Her friends are saying to her, "How do you like the new bus, Joan? Come! We are waiting for you."
Joan goes to the new bus. She gets on. All her friends are in the bus. They go home in the new bus.
Notes: wait for 等候 get on 上(车) get off 下(车)  after school 放学后

questions.text: Joan is a schoolgirl.
questions.explanation: Joan goes to school, so she should be a schoolgirl.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Inference Skills

questions.text: Joan and her friends go to school on foot.
questions.explanation: Joan and her friends go to school by bus, not on foot.

questions.text: The school bus is big and old.
questions.explanation: The text says 'The big old school bus is stopping at the bus stop'.

question_sets.context:
A boy named Jack lived in a small village. One morning, his mother sent him to his uncle's in town.
He had a very good time there.
Before Jack left in the evening, his uncle gave him a jar and said, "There is some candy in it, you may put your hand into it and take some when you want to eat something."
Jack looked at the jar when he was in the train. It had a long and small neck. He put his hand into the jar and took five pieces. But he could not get his hand out. He turned his hand this way and that way, still he could not get his hand out. He turned his hand again. Finally he let go of four pieces. Then he could pull his hand out of the jar.

questions.text: One day Jack's mother sent him to his mother's brother's house.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Jack was sent to his uncle's house, which refers to his father's brother, not his mother's brother.

questions.text: The jar with some candy in it had a large neck.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states the jar had a long and small neck.

questions.text: Jack only stayed in town for a whole day.
questions.explanation: The passage says Jack left in the evening, implying he spent the day there.

questions.text: At last Jack only took one piece of candy at a time.
questions.explanation: He took five pieces initially, then let go of four, implying he was trying to take more than one at a time initially, but succeeded with one at the end.

questions.text: From this lesson, Jack knew that he himself was too foolish.
questions.explanation: The passage infers he learned a lesson about greed and the consequences of taking too much.

question_sets.context:
In England , people often talk about the weather because you can experience (感受) four seasons in one day . In the morning the weather is warm just like in spring . An hour later black clouds come, and then is rains hard .The weather gets a little colder . In the afternoon the sky will be clear , the sun will begin to shine , it will be summer at this of year .
In England ,you can also have summer in winter , or have winter in summer . So in winter you can swim sometimes , and in summer sometimes you should take warm clothes . When you go to England , you will see that some English people usually take an umbrella or a raincoat with them in the sunny morning , but you should not laugh at them . If you don't do like that , maybe you will regret(后悔) later in the day .

questions.text: People not very often talk about the weather in England.
questions.explanation: First sentence indicates that people often talk about the weather in England.

questions.text: In England people can have different seasons in a day .
questions.explanation: First sentence indicates that you can experience four seasons in one day.

questions.text: Sometimes you can have a swim in winter in England .
questions.explanation: You can swim sometimes in winter.

questions.text: You never need to wear warm clothes in summer in England.
questions.explanation: Sometimes you should take warm clothes in summer.

questions.text: Some England people usually take an umbrella or a raincoat with them because it often rains in England .
questions.explanation: Some English people usually take an umbrella or a raincoat with them.

question_sets.context: Every day we eat a lot of food. But different people in different countries eat different kinds of food. My friend Robert comes from America and he tells me a lot about food in America. We Chinese people eat a lot of pork (猪肉). But beef(牛肉)is more popular in America. We often have rice or noodles at every meal(一顿饭). But Americans may think hamburgers and apple pies are more delicious. Chinese children like to eat ice creams in summer. But Americans love ice creams in the dish nearly every meal. Today Americans eat more than two billion (十亿)ice creams a year.

questions.text: Different people in different countries eat the same kind of food every day.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that different people eat different kinds of food.

questions.text: Chinese people like eating pork, but Americans don't.
questions.explanation: The text mentions that Chinese people eat a lot of pork, and beef is more popular in America, suggesting Americans eat less pork.

questions.text: Americans think hamburgers and apple pies are more delicious than rice and noodles.
questions.explanation: The text states that Americans 'may think hamburgers and apple pies are more delicious'.

questions.text: Chinese people eat ice creams every day.
questions.explanation: The text mentions that Chinese children like to eat ice cream in the summer, not every day.

questions.text: Americans eat ice creams at every meal.
questions.explanation: The text states that Americans love to eat ice cream 'nearly every meal'.

question_sets.context: Lucy and Lily had a good time last Sunday． They got up very early． After breakfast they went to a park． In the park, they saw a lot of flowers． Lucy wanted to pick one of them． But Lily stopped her． Then they went to the river． By the river they found a small boat． They got into (进入) the boat and started boating on the river． Two hours later, they left the boat and began to climb the hill near the river． They reached (到达) the top (顶部) at half past eleven． There they had their lunch． What did they have for lunch? Eggs, bread and some oranges． In the afternoon, they went home． Their mother asked them, "Did you enjoy yourselves?" "Yes, very much． " They answered．

questions.text: Lucy and Lily went to a park last Saturday．
questions.explanation: The passage states they went to the park last Sunday, not Saturday.

questions.text: In the park, Lucy picked some flowers．
questions.explanation: The passage indicates Lucy wanted to pick flowers, but Lily stopped her.

questions.text: They had lunch before they started to climb the hill．
questions.explanation: The passage indicates they climbed the hill and then had lunch at the top.

questions.text: They had eggs, bread and some oranges for lunch．
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states they had eggs, bread, and some oranges for lunch.

question_sets.context:
J.K. Rowling was born in England in 1965. She loved reading, and wrote her first story, Rabbit, when she was only six years old. She studied French at university, and then worked as a secretary in London. She had the idea for Harry Potter when she was on a train. She started writing the first Harry Potter the next day.
In 1992, she went to live in Portugal for three years. She wrote Harry Potter in the morning, and worked as an English teacher in the afternoon and evening. She got married to a Portuguese TV reporter and had a daughter called Jessica.
Then she returned to Britain and lived in Edinburgh, Scotland. She was unemployed at that time. She wrote in cafes because there were warmer than her small house. After five years she finished the first book, Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone. The book sold millions of copies all over the world, and J. K. Rowling became very famous.

questions.text: When did J.K. Rowling write her first story?
questions.answer: When she was only six years old

questions.text: What was J.K. Rowling's first job?
questions.answer: Her first job was a secretary

questions.text: What's J.K. Rowling's daughter's name?
Why did J.K. Rowling write in cafes?
questions.answer: Because cafes were warmer than her small house

questions.text: Why is J.K. Rowling famous?
questions.answer: Because she wrote Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone

question_sets.context:
When we talk about Hollywood, we think of films and famous film stars. They're part of Hollywood's history. Today people make films in other places, too. Not all famous film starts live in Hollywood. But Hollywood is still a new special city in Los Angeles, California.
You can easily see where Hollywood is in Los Angeles. There is a big sign(标志) on the hills. It says "HOLLYWOOD". The white letters are fifty feet tall. You can see the sign from far away. The Hollywood sign is a famous Hollywood landmark(标记) in Los Angeles. Many postcards show this famous Hollywood landmark.
In the hills of Hollywood, there is also the Hollywood Bowl. This is all open-air theatre. It is one of the largest open-air theatres in the world. It has seventeen thousand seats and a very different stage(演奏台). You can listen to all kinds of concerts at the Hollywood Bowl.

questions.text: Hollywood is one part in Los Angeles.
questions.explanation: Hollywood is in Los Angeles, California.

questions.text: The word "special" in the last sentence of the first paragraph means "famous ".
questions.explanation: Synonym for "special" is "famous".

questions.text: You can't see the white letters "Hollywood" from far away.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions you can see the sign from far away.

questions.text: Hollywood Bowl is an open-air theatre.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Hollywood Bowl is an open-air theatre.

questions.text: It seems(似乎) that some famous film stars don't choose(选择) to live in Hollywood.
questions.explanation: The passage states that not all famous film stars live in Hollywood.

question_sets.context:
A man saw a boy standing beside a lake with a mirror (镜子)."Excuse me," he said, "but could you tell me what you're doing?"
"I'm fishing."
"With a mirror? Could you tell me how it works?"the man asked.
"OK, but I want five dollars."
The man wanted to know the secret very much, so he handed the boy the money."Now show me how it works," he said. "Well", the boy began, "you hold (拿) the mirror towards the water, and when a fish goes by, the sunlight in the mirror gives him a surprise. He stops and doesn't know what to do, and then you catch him at once. "The man was surprised, "Can you really catch fish with the mirror? How many did you catch?"
"You're the fifth today!" replied the boy.

questions.text: The man wanted to look at the boy's mirror.
questions.explanation: The man wanted to know how the boy used the mirror to fish.

questions.text: The man gave the boy five dollars.
questions.explanation: The man handed the boy the money.

questions.text: The boy caught five fish that day.
questions.explanation: The man was the fifth person to give him money.

questions.text: The boy got fifteen dollars that day.
questions.explanation: Not mentioned.

questions.text: When the man heard the boy's words, he would be very happy.
questions.explanation: The man was tricked.

question_sets.context:
If you really want to have a healthy and quiet holiday,you shuld go and stay on a farm for some time.There are many animals on the farm.If you like,you can take care of the young animals.The pigs,ducks goats and turkeys.I think it is very interesting.But we do it not for making any money,just for fun.The farmers must work hard on the farm to make money for their living.
I like travel,especially travel on the farm in the countryside.If I have time next weekend,I'll travel on a farm again.

questions.text: It is quiet on the farm.
questions.explanation: 文章第一句提到想要安静的假期可以去农场，因此农场是安静的。

questions.explanation: 农民在农场工作是为了谋生。

questions.text: The travellers go to the farm to make money.
questions.explanation: 文章提到去农场不是为了挣钱，而是为了乐趣。

question_sets.context:
At midnight on New Year' s Eve(除夕),people in Rome, Italy, throw out all the things they don' t want any longer. The streets are filled with old chairs, beds, clothes and plates. In Madrid, Spain, the New Year comes in more quietly. People get together in the center of the city. Each holds a bag of grapes. As the clock strikes(敲) twelve, the people eat grapes―one for each strike.
In Tokyo, Japan, people eat noodles on New Year' s Eve. This food is said to bring long life. Early the next morning some Japanese families climb Mount Fuji. There they watch the first sunrise of the new year.

questions.text: New Year' s Eve Rome must be very noisy.
questions.explanation: Throwing out unwanted items like chairs and beds would certainly create a noisy environment.

questions.text: In the center of Madrid, a Spaniard(西班牙人) brings more than fifteen grapes and waits for the New Year.
questions.explanation: Each person brings a bag of grapes and eats twelve grapes as the clock strikes twelve.

questions.text: Many happy people are in the street in Madrid on New Year' s Eve.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions people getting together in the city center, implying a happy gathering.

questions.text: People in both Madrid and Tokyo bring in the new year by eating a special food.
questions.explanation: Madrid eats grapes and Tokyo eats noodles.

questions.text: The Japanese prefer to welcome the new year by going to bed early and rising early.
questions.explanation: The Japanese climb Mount Fuji to watch the first sunrise of the new year, implying they stay up late.

question_sets.context:
Peter was an inventor. His job was to invent new things, and he worked when he had an idea. His workroom was in his house, so he could work whenever he wanted to. Sometimes he worked seven days a week and sometimes he didn' t work for days. He did all his work right at home, but he left the house to go to meetings sometimes.
Peter usually got up at about five o' clock. He made some tea and started to work at six. He drank tea all day―he couldn' t work without it―but he didn' t eat anything until in the evening.
First, Peter cleaned the workroom and turned on the answer-phone because he couldn' t talk to people when he had an idea. Then he started to work. He usually had a rest after two or three hours, but he didn' t leave the workroom. He did something different to help him relax. Sometimes he did some exercise, and sometimes he listened to music. He usually stopped working at about nine o' clock in the evening. He thought about his work most of the time, even when he was out. He was interested in what was around him and he liked looking for new ideas and new problems to solve.

questions.text: Peter was an <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that 'Peter was an inventor'.

questions.text: Peter did his work at home, but he left his house to have <blank> sometimes.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions, 'He did all his work right at home, but he left the house to go to meetings sometimes.'

questions.text: When he was working at daytime he didn' t <blank> anything until in the evening.
questions.explanation: The text says, 'He drank tea all day...but he didn't eat anything until in the evening.'

questions.text: He <blank> the answer-phone because he couldn' t talk to others.
questions.explanation: The passage says, 'Peter cleaned the workroom and turned on the answer-phone because he couldn't talk to people when he had an idea.'

questions.text: To relax,he often did some exercise and <blank> in his workroom.
questions.explanation: The text says, 'Sometimes he did some exercise, and sometimes he listened to music.'

question_sets.context:
What is a library for? Most libraries have books and other things to read. Many of them have things to listen to. Some libraries even have computers.
Very few people would think of a library as a place to live in.
One library in New York City turned into a home for 250 people for several days. They moved into their library and slept on the floor. Why did the people do so? Because the city wanted to close it to save money. These New Yorkers loved their library. They didn't want to lose it. So they moved in.
At last the city agreed to keep the library open, and the people all went home.

questions.text: Not every library have computers.
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'Some libraries even have computers,' indicating that not all libraries have them.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Once 250 people lived in a library in London.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that 250 people lived in a library in New York City, not London.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Those people moved into the library in order to save money.
questions.explanation: The people moved into the library because they didn't want to lose it, as the city wanted to close it to save money.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Cause & Effect

questions.text: At last the city agreed to open another library.
questions.explanation: The city agreed to keep the existing library open, not to open another one.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

question_sets.context: Swimming is very popular in summer. People like swimming in summer because water makes them feel cool. If you swim in a wrong place, it may not be safe. These years, more than ten people died in this city while they were enjoying in the water and most of them were students. But some people are still not careful in swimming. They often think they swim so well that nothing can happen to them in water. Summer is here again. If you go swimming, don't forget that better swimmers have died in water. They died because they were not careful, not because they were not good at swimming. So don't get into water when you are alone. If there is a "No swimming" sign, don't get into water, either. If you remember all this, swimming will be safer.

questions.text: Swimming is a very safe sport.
questions.explanation: The passage states that swimming can be unsafe in wrong places, indicating it's not always safe.

questions.text: We shouldn't swim in some wrong places.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly advises against swimming in unsafe or wrong places.

questions.text: Only students died in water.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that most of the people who died were students, but it does not say ONLY students died.

questions.text: If you are good at swimming, you will not died in water.
questions.explanation: The passage states that even better swimmers have died because they were not careful, showing that being good at swimming doesn't guarantee safety.

questions.text: If we often practice swimming, we will be safer.
questions.explanation: The passage emphasis that even better swimmers have died because they were not careful, it doesn't indicate that practice makes one safer.

question_sets.context:
A young man couldn't sleep well every night. He was very worried. One day he went to see the doctor. The doctor looked him over carefully. But nothing wrong with him. The doctor told him to count from 1 to 10 again and again. "Keep doing it until you fall asleep," the doctor said.
After a few days, the young man came to the doctor again. But to his surprise, the doctor found the young man was even worse than before! "Didn't you count as I told you?" the doctor asked. "Yes, I did," the young man answered. "But every time when I reached eight, I couldn't help jumping from bed."
"But why?" the doctor wanted to know. The young man said, "I am a boxer."(拳击运动员)

questions.text: The young man had to go to see a doctor because _______________________
questions.answer: He couldn't sleep well every night
questions.explanation: From the first sentence of the passage we know the answer.

questions.text: Was there anything wrong with the young man? ________________________
questions.explanation: The doctor looked him over carefully. But nothing wrong with him.

questions.text: The doctor told the young man to ____________________________________
questions.answer: count from 1 to 10 again and again
questions.explanation: The doctor told him to count from 1 to 10 again and again. "Keep doing it until you fall asleep," the doctor said.

questions.text: The young man came to the doctor again because ________________________
questions.answer: the doctor found the young man was even worse than before
questions.explanation: But to his surprise, the doctor found the young man was even worse than before!
The young man said, "I am a boxer."

question_sets.context:
The "big day" has arrived for Agnes. She is finally leaving the hospital after a long illness. Her husband, Clark, is pushing her in a wheelchair. They say good-bye to the nurses as they pass by on their way to the hospital.
Agnes was ill for more than six weeks. The doctors were not sure about her illness. At first they thought that she needed an operation(手术). Finally, after many tests, the doctors gave her some new medicine. Now, she is nearly well.

questions.text: 1. The story took place in the hospital.
questions.explanation: The passage describes Agnes leaving the hospital after a long illness, indicating the story takes place there.

questions.text: 2. Agnes was ill for over six weeks.
questions.explanation: The text explicitly states that Agnes was ill for more than six weeks.

questions.text: 3. At first the doctors thought they should operate on her.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that initially, doctors believed she needed an operation.

questions.text: 4. After an operation, the doctors gave her some new medicine.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that after many tests, they gave her new medicine, not after an operation.

questions.text: 5. Agnes is OK now.
questions.explanation: The text says that Agnes is nearly well, implying she is okay.

question_sets.context:
Last summer I went to the Inner Mongolia Grassland(内蒙古草原). It was wonderful! I love the grassland very much. The grass was very high and it reached my knees(膝盖).There were many sheep and cows there. You couldn't see the end of the grassland. We rode horses there. I'm not good at riding. With the help of the herdsman(牧人), I got on a horse. At first I was a little afraid, but after a while, I began to learn how to control(控制)the horse.
The people there were very friendly to us. They invited us to eat cheese and mutten(羊肉). Then we watched a horse-riding race(比赛). It was great! I really had a good time.

questions.text: The writer's last summer's trip was to visit Hainan Island.
questions.explanation: The writer's last summer's trip was to visit Inner Mongolia Grassland, not Hainan Island.

questions.text: The writer loves the mountains there very much.
questions.explanation: The writer loves the grassland very much, not the mountains.

questions.text: There were only sheep there.
questions.explanation: There were many sheep and cows there.

questions.text: In the passage the writer told us nobody there helped them ride horses.
questions.explanation: With the help of the herdsman, I got on a horse.

questions.text: The writer had a great time in the Inner Mongolia grassland.
questions.explanation: I really had a good time.

question_sets.context:
Tom and Mike were good friends. Sometimes they were kind to each other, sometimes they were not. But some of their classmates said they were like brothers. One day they went out for a walk together. At noon they were very hungry and they went into a restaurant to have lunch. The waiter came up to them and asked, "What can I do for you?" "Please bring us two apples first." said Tom. When the waiter put the two apples on the table, Mike took the bigger one at once. Tom got angry. "You are impolite (没礼貌). Why didn't you take the smaller one?" Tom said.
"But I was right," said Mike with a smile. "If I let you take first, which one will you choose?" "Of course I'll take the smaller one." said Tom. "Yes," Mike said, "If you take the smaller one, the bigger one will be mine. Don't you think so?" "Oh." Tom couldn't answer.

questions.text: Tom and Mike were not kind to each other.
questions.explanation: The text says "Sometimes they were kind to each other".

questions.text: They went out to sit in a restaurant.
questions.explanation: The text says "they went into a restaurant to have lunch."

questions.text: The waiter brought them two apples before the meal.
questions.explanation: The text says "Please bring us two apples first." said Tom.

questions.text: Mike took the bigger apple.
questions.explanation: The text says "Mike took the bigger one at once."

questions.text: At last Tom had the bigger apple.
questions.explanation: The text doesn't mention who had the bigger apple at last.

question_sets.context: Class 9 had a picnic by the Niujiao River last Saturday. They took a lot of food and all kinds of drinks like rice, bread, cakes, vegetables, meat, fish, chicken, beef, juice, coke, milk and so on. Some students took lots of firewood and a few pans with them, others took some bowls and plates. When they got to the Niujiao River, they started to do the cooking. After they had the picnic, they played games on the riverside. Some students sang a few English songs, others danced happily. They enjoyed themselves there. They didn't return home until five o'clock.

questions.text: The students in Class 9 had no classes last Saturday.
questions.explanation: The passage states they had a picnic last Saturday, implying they didn't have classes.

questions.text: The students took many things for the picnic.
questions.explanation: The passage lists many items they took, confirming they took many things.

questions.text: The students did the cooking with their teachers' help.
questions.explanation: The passage doesn't mention teachers helping with the cooking.

questions.text: They went to the Niujiao River by bus.
questions.explanation: The passage does not mention how they went to the river.

questions.text: They went back home after five o'clock.
questions.explanation: The passage states they didn't return home until five o'clock.

question_sets.context:
Tea is popular in the world, but more than three hundred years ago most of the people in Europe did not know anything about tea.
Once an English doctor came back from China for Christmas holiday. He gave his mother some tea as a present. She told her friends about the present and asked them to come to a "tea party". When her friends came, the old woman took out some tea-leaves and asked them to eat. Of course, nobody liked the tea-leaves.
Just at that time the doctor came in. He looked at the table and asked, "Mother, what did you do with the tea?"
"I boiled it as you said."
"And what did you do with the water?"
"I poured it away, of course." answered the old woman.
"Now you may throw away the leaves, too."said the doctor.

questions.text: The doctor was an Englishman.
questions.explanation: The passage says "Once an English doctor came back from China for Christmas holiday."

questions.text: The doctor gave his mother some tea as New Year's present.
questions.explanation: The passage says "He gave his mother some tea as a present.", and the doctor came back for Christmas holiday.

questions.text: The old woman did not know how to drink tea.
questions.explanation: The old woman asked her friends to eat the tea-leaves, which shows that she did not know how to drink tea.

questions.text: In the story, everyone liked drinking tea.
questions.explanation: The passage says "When her friends came, the old woman took out some tea-leaves and asked them to eat. Of course, nobody liked the tea-leaves."

questions.text: More than three hundred years ago nobody in Europe knew anything about tea.
questions.explanation: The passage says "Tea is popular in the world, but more than three hundred years ago most of the people in Europe did not know anything about tea."

question_sets.context:
Mr. Turner works in a factory. He often feels tired and likes sleeping at home. His wife is a conductor and likes dancing. She often goes dancing if she isn' t on duty. He tells her to do some housework, but she doesn' t listen to him. His mother Mrs. Turner has to do all for them.
Once the old woman was ill and had to be in hospital. Her daughter went to look after her there. Two months later she came back, all their rooms were in terrible mess(零乱不堪). She couldn't tidy them and told her son to do it. The young man didn' t answer her. She said nothing and had to stay in bed.
One day, Mr. Turner's wife was free. She wanted to go dancing, but she didn't find her new sweater. She asked her husband to help her. The young man didn't do it, "Our sheet(床单)isn' t clean, "said the woman, "You'd better wash it tomorrow. ""I' 11 be busy, "said the man. "Turn it over. ""How lazy(懒)you are! "said the woman, "I turned it over one and a half months ago! "

questions.text: The old woman has to do all for her son and his wife.
questions.explanation: The text mentions: His mother Mrs. Turner has to do all for them.

questions.text: The rooms were all in a terrible mess for more than two months.
questions.explanation: The text mentions: Two months later she came back, all their rooms were in terrible mess.

questions.text: Mr. Turner' s mother is too old to help her son.
questions.explanation: The text does not mention the age of Mr. Turner's mother.

questions.text: The phrase(短语)"turn over'in the story means"翻过来".
questions.explanation: In context, 'turn over' refers to turning the sheet over to use the other side.

questions.text: The wife is not the laziest in the family
questions.explanation: The woman is lazy as the text describes she asks her husband to turn over the sheet.

question_sets.context:
Visit the Edinburgh Festival
Every year, thousands of people come to Edinburgh(爱丁堡), the capital city of Scotland, to be part of the Edinburgh Festival. For three weeks every August and September the city is filled with actors and artists from all over the world. They come to Edinburgh for the biggest arts festival in Britain. During this time the streets of the city are alive(具有活力的) with music and dance from early morning until late at night. You can even see artists painting pictures on the streets. One of the best parts of the Festival is the "Fringe", where students do comedy shows in small halls and cafés.
Tens of thousands of tourists come to the Festival to see new films and plays and hear music played by famous musicians. This year, you can see over five hundred performances with actors from more than forty countries.
The tickets for these performances are quite cheap and it is usually easier to see your favourite star in Edinburgh than it is in London. So come to Edinburgh next summer, but remember it can be difficult to find a room, so why not book your hotel now?

questions.text: The Edinburgh Festival is a month long.
questions.explanation: The festival lasts for three weeks.

questions.text: You can hear music all day during the Festival.
questions.explanation: The streets are alive with music from early morning until late at night.

questions.text: More than ten thousand students come to the Edinburgh Festival every year.

question_sets.context:
Tom and David were in the same class. It was a little far from their school. David had a bike, but Tom didn't. He had to get up early in the morning. After breakfast he went to the bus stop quickly to wait for the bus. Tom asked his father to buy him a bike, his father said "Well, I can buy a bike for you next term."
Tom was happy, but he must learn to ride. He helped his mother with the washing and cleaning on Saturday. After lunch, he went to David's home. Mrs. White opened the door, "Can David come out and play with me?" asked the boy, "Sorry, but he is sleeping now." answered his mother, "Then can his bike come out to play." Tom asked hopefully.

question_sets.context: Eating healthily is important for you. Good eating habits are good for you in your whole(整个的) life. Your body needs energy(能量) to work. Where does the energy from? It's from the food you eat every day. But it's not from one kind of food. It needs many different kinds of foods. To balance your diet, you should try to eat different foods. You are what you eat. For example, if you eat too much meat but little other foods, you will be fat. In fact, our body needs nutrients(营养) from many kinds of food like meat, vegetables, fruits and sugars(糖). Don't forget to brush(刷) your teeth after eating sugars, because sugars are bad for your teeth.

question_sets.context: Everyone has a name. Names are different in different countries. Chinese usually have two, three or four Chinese words in a name. They put their family name first and then the given name. But in England and America the last name is the family name. To many people the meaning of the name is important. Fathers and mothers always want to give beautiful names to girls and great names to boys. People use Mr, Mrs, Ms or Miss before their family name. In foreign countries children can call their father or mother's name directly(直接地). But in China they can never do that because it is not polite.

question_sets.context: "Early to bed, early to rise" makes a man healthy. It's good for the body. This is an old saying. Have you heard of it before? It means that we must go to bed early at night and get up early in the morning. Then we shall be healthy. We shall also be rich(healthy) and clever( wise). That is true. The body must have enough sleep to be healthy. Children of young age should have enough sleep can't do their work very well. They will not be wise and they may not become wealthy! The body also needs exercise: walking, running, jumping, swimming, playing games and all other exercise. Exercise keeps the body strong. Exercise also helps the blood to move around inside the body. This is very important Our blood takes food to all parts of our body. The head also needs blood. Exercise helps us to think better.

question_sets.context:
Mr and Mrs Brown lived in a small town near London with their child. Sometimes Mr Brown came back home from work very late, when his wife and the child were asleep, and then he opened the front door of this house with his key(钥匙)and came in very quiet.
But one night when he was coming home very late, he lost(丢)his key, so when he reached his house, he rang the bell. Nothing happened. He rang it again. Again nothing happened.
Nobody moved inside the house. Mr Brown knocked at(敲)the bedroom window, he spoke to his wife, he shouted, but she didn't wake up. At last he stopped and thought for a moment. Then he began to speak like a small child. \! Mother! "he said. \! I want to go to the toilet! "He spoke quite quietly but at once(立刻)Mrs Brown woke up. Then he spoke to her, and she opened the door for him.

question_sets.context: Swimming is very popular in summer. People like swimming in summer because water makes them feel cool. If you swim in a wrong place, it may not be safe. These years, more than ten people died in this city while they were enjoying in the water and most of them were students. But some people are still not careful in swimming. They often think they swim so well that nothing can happen to them in water. Summer is here again. If you go swimming, don't forget that better swimmers have died in water. They died because they were not careful, not because they were not good at swimming. So don't get into water when you are alone. If there is a 'No swimming' sign, don't get into water, either. If you remember all this, swimming will be safer.

questions.explanation: The passage states that swimming can be unsafe if done in the wrong place.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly advises against swimming in the wrong places.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that better swimmers have died because they were not careful.

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes being careful, not just being good at swimming.

question_sets.context: At the gate of a big office in London there was a book. All the clerks had to write down their names in it when they arrived each morning. At nine o'clock, the manager's secretary, who lived in a small room above the offices, had to draw a red line under the last name in the book. When someone came after that, he had to explain why he was late. If there was a thick fog in the city, the first person to arrive late usually wrote "Be late by fog" under the red line in the book. Everyone else after him just put "ditto". But one foggy morning, the first man to arrive late wrote "My wife had a baby early this morning " instead of "Delayed by fog" under the red line in the book. After that, twenty or thirty people put "ditto" under that as usual.

question_sets.context:
Of all the things we eat and drink, water is the most important. Not many people understand this, but it is quite true. The human body can go without food for a long time, but two or three days without water usually make people dead.
Many people don't understand how much water the human body needs and they don't drink enough, especially in hot weather. Most people drink when they feel thirsty. They often need more water especially (尤其) when they have sports.
A man's body is 65 to 70 percent (百分之一) of water. If we don't have enough water, we may feel tired and may become ill.
Now you'll see how important the water is.

question_sets.context:
We drink tea every day. But more than three hundred years ago most people in Europe did not know any thing about tea. Some people had heard about it, but very few of them knew what to do about it.
There is a story about an English sailor who went to countries in the west, the east and the south. He had been to India and China. One day he came home and brought some tea as a present for his mother. She told her friends about the present and asked them to a "tea party". When her friends came to the"tea party", the old woman brought out some tea leaves and asked them to eat. Of course, nobody liked the tea leaves. At that time, the sailor came in. He looked at the table and said, "Mother, what have you done with the tea?"" I boiled it as you said."" And what did you do with the water?"" I throw it away, of course," answered the old woman." Now, you may throw away the leaves, too," said the sailor.

questions.text: Most Europeans didn't know anything about tea more than 300 years ago.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage indicates that most Europeans didn't know anything about tea more than 300 years ago.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Supporting Details

questions.text: The English sailor had been to China, but he hadn't been to India.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the English sailor had been to both China and India.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: The sailor's mother boiled the tea and threw away the leaves.
questions.explanation: The sailor's mother boiled the tea and threw away the water, not the leaves, according to the story, thus the statement is incorrect..
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: It was the sailor who told her to do so.
questions.explanation: The sailor did not tell her to throw away the water. Therefore, the statement is false.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
I go on a camping(露营)trip in the mountains with my classmates．After hiking all day,we find a place to camp for the night．We make a campfire so that we can cook our dinner．We roast(烤)some hot dogs and potatoes and drink lemonade(柠檬汽水)．Then,when it gets dark,we tell ghost(鬼)stories around the campfire．
Later when we lie down to go to sleep,we listen to the sounds of crickets(蟋蟀)and small animals moving around in the grass．We think there are some ghosts nearby．"What's that?"my friend Kathy asks．"What?"we ask．"I think I hear someone walking in the woods．"Kathy says．Soon we all hear footsteps and we are all so_scared_that we can't get to sleep．
Of course,there is no one there,but we have very active imaginations(丰富的想象力)．

question_sets.context:
A boy named Jack lived in a small village. One morning, his mother sent him to his uncle's house in town. He had a very good time there.
Before Jack left in the evening, his uncle gave him a jar and said, "There is some candy in it, you may put your hand into it and take some out when you want to eat them."
Jack looked at the jar when he was in the train. It had a long and small neck. He put his hand into the jar and took five pieces. But he could not get his hand out. He turned his hand this way and that way. It does't work. Finally he let four pieces go. Then he could pull his hand out of the jar.

questions.explanation: He took five pieces at first.

question_sets.context: I can still remember my first day at school. I was only 6 years old at that time. It was very big room. I sat at the desk near the window, but I couldn't see anything because the windows were too high. There was a big map of the world on the wall and an old blackboard. I don't think I was worried or afraid at that time. There was another little boy next to me. He sat there and kept quiet at first. Then he began to cry, because he didn't want to stay there. More and more students came in, but the boy didn't stop crying. Later the teacher came in. She went to the small boy and said something to him. The boy stopped crying soon and began to smile. I still don't know what the teacher said to the little boy to this day.

question_sets.context:
The North Pole is farther north than any other place on Earth. It is easy to find on a globe. It is where all the north and south lines come together at the top.
If you were standing on the North Pole, there would be only one way to go. No matter which way you turned, you would be going south. No place on Earth is north of the North Pole.
Even though it is called the North Pole, there is really no pole there. There is not even any land. Only thick ice covers the sea. It took many years to find the exact spot where the North Pole is. The first person to reach it was a black man, Matthew A. Henson.

question_sets.context:
Mr and Mrs Bell are very forgetful (健忘的). For example, Mr Bell sometimes goes to his office for work on Sunday morning, for he thinks it is Monday. And Mrs Bell sometimes forget to cook supper for the family.
One summer they planned(计划)to fly to New York for their holidays. They got to the airport only ten minutes before the plane took off. So time was short. But suddenly Mrs. Bell said she must tell Alice, their daughter, not to forget to lock the front door when she went to school. As Alice was then at school, they couldn't tell her about it by telephone. So they hurried to the post office. Mrs. Bell wrote a short note to Alice while Mr. Bell bought a stamp and an envelope (信封). Soon the note was ready. They put the stamp on the envelope in a hurry and dropped it in the letter box, but suddenly Mrs. Bell began to cry. The short note was still in her hand. She had put the plane tickets in the envelope.

question_sets.context:
One day, my wife and I went shopping. Because my brother and his family were going to spend the weekend with us, we had a lot of things to buy. So we took the car. We stopped the car in front of the shop . An hour later we came back to the car with a lot of things, then the trouble started. We could not open the car door.
"Oh dear, " said my wife, "What are we going to do?"
"Let's ask that police man, "I said.
The policeman was very kind and glad to help us. Soon he got the door open. Just at that moment an angry man came up and shouted(大声喊), "What are you doing with my car?" We looked at the number of the car, and our faces turned very red.

Mr and Mrs Brown lived in a small house near London with their child. Sometimes Mr Brown came back home from work very late, when his wife and the child were asleep, and he opened the front door of his house with his key and came in very quietly.
But one night when he was coming home very late, he lost his key, so when he got to his house, he rang the bell. Nothing happened. He rang it again. Again nothing happened. Mr Brown knocked at the bedroom window, he spoke to his wife, he shouted, but she didn't wake up. At last he stopped and thought for a few seconds. Then he began to speak like a small child. "Mother!"he said,"I want to go to the lavatory(厕所)!" He spoke very quietly but at once Mrs Brown woke up. Then he spoke to her and she opened the door for him.

The Sunday paper is usually very thick. It has many advertisements (广告) and many different parts. The parents in the family like the front page, and the world news page. Many men also read the sports page.
Most men don't read the women's pages, but the mother of the family usually does. The women's pages have the news about parties, food, health and clothes. Most Sunday papers have interesting stories. Children enjoy them. Old people read the death notices(讣告). They tell about people who have died during the week.

question_sets.context:
In school, boys and girls are learning foreign languages. Do you know how many languages there are in the world? There are about one thousand and five hundred. English is one of the most important languages because so many people use it, not only in England and America, but in other countries of the world. It is difficult to say how many people are learning it. Millions of boys and girls are trying to do so. Many English children study French. French is also a very important language. Some children study German, Russian, Japanese and Chinese.
Which is the best way to learn a language? We know that we all learnt our own language well when we were children. If we learn a second language in the same way, it won't seem so difficult. How does a small child do? He listens to what people say, and he tries to guess what he hears. When he wants something, he has to ask for it. He is using the language, thinking it and talking it all the time. If people use a second language all the time, they will learn it quickly.

questions.text: There are about 1500 languages in the world.
questions.explanation: The first paragraph states, "There are about one thousand and five hundred languages."

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that many English children study French, not Spanish.

questions.text: The best way to learn a language isn't mentioned in the passage.
questions.explanation: The passage discusses the best way to learn a language by mimicking how children learn their first language.

questions.text: If people use a second language all the time, they will learn it quickly.
questions.explanation: The passage concludes by stating that consistent use of a second language leads to quicker learning.

question_sets.context:
My name is Qing Min. I'm a middle-school school. I am studying in No. 1 Middle school. My school isn't big, but I like it very much.
In my school there are eighteen classes. There are about fifty students in every class. We have twenty-seven teachers. I'm in Class 4, Grade 2. In my classroom there are twenty-six desks and fifty-two chairs. There's a map of China and a map of the world(世界)on the wall. My classroom is big and clean.
There are twenty-eight boys and twenty-four girls in my class. We have English, Chinese, maths and five other subjects(学科). Every morning some of as come to school by bus. Some get to school by bike, but sometimes I come to school on foot. My English teacher often says, Please be careful(小心)when (当……时)you come to school by bike. He is a good teacher. We like him very much.
I love my school, because(因为)our teachers are very friendly to us. We must study hard(努力)for the people.

question_sets.context: New York, London and other big cities are exciting places to live in. There are many things to see and to do. You can go to different kinds of museums, plays and films. But there are problems in big cities, too. The things are expensive and there are too many people. They are moving to big cities because it is easier to find jobs, to study at good schools and to find good doctors there. But sometimes, some people cannot get a good job or a nice place to live in, and sometimes it's hard to keep big cities safe and clean because there are too many people. So, before you move to big cities, you should think about the problems of living there.

question_sets.context:
In the southern part of the earth lies a beautiful island country. It is Australia. Though it has only a population of 17 million, it is much larger than Britain in area.
People call Australia "a country on sheep's back", because it has long been a sheep farming country. Sydney is the largest city in Australia, but its capital is Canberra.
In Australia, there are many wonderful places to visit, such as Alice Springs and Ayers Rock in the center and also the Opera House in Sydney Harbor. They are all world 
Cfamous.
Weather in Australia is neither hot nor too cold. If you pay a visit to Australia, you can either enjoy your walk in its rain forests or go for a swim in its warm seas.

Mr Jones had a nice brown coat. He loved it very much, but his wife did not like it, because it was old. She often said, "Give it to a poor man." But Jones always said, "No, I like this coat."
Then a cigarette (香烟) fell on it and made a hole in it, so Mrs Jones said, "Please don't wear it again." Mr Jones took it to a small tailor's shop (裁缝店) and said to the tailor, "Please make another coat like this one." The tailor made the coat very carefully. Then lit (点燃) a cigarette, and made a hole in it in the same place.

question_sets.context:
One day a rich man met Sam. The rich man asked, "I hear you are very clever and nothing is difficult for you. Can you tell me why you are so clever?" Sam answered with a smile, "Oh, I'm not clever. But you are too silly." The rich man became very angry.
Sam said, "Master, please don't be angry. If you don't believe what I said, now let me ask you a question, if you have a group of sheep, I sent you another group. Then, how many groups of sheep do you have?" 'Alas! That's the easiest question in the world. One plus one is two. Anybody knows that. I have two groups of sheep.' Sam laughed and said, 'You are wrong, Master. Two groups of sheep put together is still one group. That's the easiest question in the world.'

questions.text: The rich man is much sillier than Sam.
questions.explanation: Based on the passage, Sam thinks that the rich man is silly.

questions.text: Sam's words made the rich man glad.
questions.explanation: The passage says the rich man became very angry after Sam's words.

questions.text: One group of sheep plus one group of sheep is two groups of sheep.
questions.explanation: Sam argues that two groups of sheep put together are still one group.

questions.text: All people know one plus one is two.
questions.explanation: The rich man stated that anybody knows that "one plus one is two."

questions.text: The rich man's answer is wrong.
questions.explanation: Sam said that the rich man's answer was wrong because two groups of sheep put together are still one group.

question_sets.context:
I have a good friend, David. We work in the same police station. He is a young policeman. He is very fat. He can not catch(抓住) thieves because he runs slowly. I am a police supervisor(警督), but he doesn't get any promotion.(提拔)
One day we talked with each other on our way home. I said, "David , you should take exercise and make yourself healthy."
"I am a lazy man, as you know, Victor," he said. " After work I always sleep."
"I think you will be a good policeman," I told him. "I can help you, David. You should do as I tell you."
I bought a pair of shorts and a black T-shirt for him. I asked him to run every morning.
Then one morning, I wanted to know if he ran or not. I drove my police car to the road. I saw a man sitting on the side of the road. It was David. I was a little angry. Just then David saw me. He began to run. I drove my car after him. He ran fast.
There were some people watching us. They didn't know what happened(发生). Suddenly(突然) a young man ran to David and caught him. The young man took David to me," I have caught the man for you, sir. You can bring him to your police station now."
I had to say , "thank you ,sir. You are a brave(勇敢的) man,"

questions.text: The young man thought David was bad man.

questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Character Motivation

question_sets.context: Mrs Brown had two sons. John, nine years old, and Bill, seven years old. The two brothers often quarreled from morning till night. One Sunday, when Mrs Brown was doing the washing, Bill came and asked her for some money for sweets. “Sweets aren't good for your teeth,” Mrs Brown said. “Take these two oranges instead and give one to John.” One of the oranges was quite a lot bigger than the other. Bill liked oranges, so he kept the big one and gave the small one to John. “It is selfish,” said John in a sad voice. “If mother had given me these oranges, I would give you the big one.” “I know you would,” Bill said with a smile. “That is why I took the big one.”

question_sets.context:
When you're invited to have dinner in a foreigner's home, please remember the following:
At table , when the hostess (女主人) picks up her napkin (餐巾), you may pick up yours and put it on your legs.
If a servant (佣人) passes food around, he will pass the dish to you at your left hand so that you can easily serve youself with your right hand. Never serve yourself while the dish is on your right; it is then the turn of your neighbour on the right.
Do not reach across the table or in front of someone to get something ---that is not polite. Ask him or her to pass it to you.
There are things in the middle of the table , such as bread, butter, and candies. You shouldn't take any until the hostess tells the servant to pass them to you .
Do not leave your seat without saying anything.If you need to leave the table to the washroom or do something else, you should say "Excuse me for a moment, please."

questions.answer: I will pick up mine and put it on my legs when the hostess picks up hers.
questions.explanation: At table , when the hostess (女主人) picks up her napkin (餐巾), you may pick up yours and put it on your legs.

questions.text: The dish is passed to you at your left hand side or right hand side?
questions.explanation: If a servant (佣人) passes food around, he will pass the dish to you at your left hand.

questions.text: If the food is far from you , what should you do ?
questions.answer: I should ask him or her to pass it to me.
questions.explanation: Ask him or her to pass it to you.

questions.text: May you take any food at any time?
questions.explanation: You shouldn't take any until the hostess tells the servant to pass them to you .

questions.text: When you have to leave your seat, what do you need to say?
questions.answer: I need to say "Excuse me for a moment, please."
questions.explanation: you should say "Excuse me for a moment, please."

question_sets.context: Mrs Robinson was a teacher in a big school in a city in America. She had boys and girls in her class, and she always enjoys teaching them, because they were quick and thought about everything carefully. One day she said to the children, "People in many countries in Asia (亚洲) wear white clothes at funerals (葬礼), but people in America and in Europe( 欧洲) wear white clothes when they're happy. What colour does a woman wear in this country when she marries, Mary?" "White, Miss, because she's happy." "That's good, Mary." Mrs Robinson said, "You are quite right. She wears white because she's happy." But then one of the boys in the class put up his hand. "Yes, Dick!" Mrs Robinson said, "Do you want to ask something?" "Yes, please. Miss." Dick said, "Why do men wear black in this country when they marry, Miss?"

question_sets.context: These two letters appeared(出现)in a newspaper. Both writers have their own ideas on zoos. Zoos Do a Good Job. It is good to keep animals in mos. I know a lot of people think it is wrong to keep animals in zoos. However(然而), I think that zoos have many good points(优点). First, zoos are places for people to see many different kinds of animals from all over the world. Without zoos, most people would never see a real bear or tiger. Second, zoos look after the animals very well. The animals are always given food and cleaned regularly(定期地). In the wild, it is not always possible for an animal to find food, so sometimes it goes hungry. But animals that are kept in zoos never go hungry. Third, zoos protect the animals they look after. They give them safe places to live in. In the wild, some kinds of animals are in danger (危险)of becoming extinct. But zoos give these animals a chance to live. Without zoos, there would be fewer kinds of animals in the world. Maria Smith Zoos are unnatural in Maria's letter, she says that zoos are good for animals. But I don't think that zoos are good for animals, they are only good for people. It is unnatural(非自然的)to keep wild animals in cages. Most animals are kept in cages that are too small for them. In the wild, these animals would travel freely. In zoos, they can't do this. This is why the bears and tigers look so sad. Most cages are not very clean either. It is true that zoos give the animals food regularly, but this is not natural. Wild animals are used to (习惯于)looking for their own food. Would anyone be happy if you don't let him go outside his home? Would Maria like to have lots of people standing outside her apartment looking at her? No, she wouldn't. And animals don't like it either. Philip Black.

questions.text: Maria and Philip have quite different ideas on keeping animals in zoos.
questions.explanation: Maria believes zoos are beneficial, while Philip thinks they are unnatural and bad for animals.

questions.text: Maria thinks that people can only see a real bear or tiger in zoos.
questions.explanation: Maria thinks zoos provide a place for people to see animals from all over the world, not that it is the only place.

questions.text: Maria thinks that animals can live better in zoos than in the wild.
questions.explanation: Maria thinks that zoos look after the animals very well, gives them safe places to live in, and give these animals a chance to live.

questions.explanation: Philip says that zoos are only good for people.

questions.text: In the two letters, they are discussing how to make animals in zoos happy.
questions.explanation: They are discussing zoos are good or bad.

Jim was a waiter. He liked to plant flowers in his garden when he was free. One Sunday morning after breakfast he put on his old clothes and began digging in his garden at 8:00.He dug and dug. Half an hour later he suddenly found a coin(硬币) near his foot. He was very glad. He put it in his right pocket. A few minutes later, he found another one. He picked it up and put it into the same pocket. The same thing happened for the third time, fourth time and fifth time...He was very happy and told his wife about it. She was very happy, too. She said,"A thief stole(偷) a lot of coins from a shop a few months ago. The policemen caught him but they didn' t find any coins."
Then Jim went on digging for some more coins, but just when he began to dig, he felt something cold in his trousers. It ran down one of his legs. He put his hand down quickly-and the coin came into his hand. Now he knew there was a hole in his pocket.

questions.text: Jim worked in a factory, he worked hard.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Jim was a waiter, not a factory worker.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: He dug for half an hour, then he found a coin at 8:00.
questions.explanation: He started digging at 8:00 and found the coin half an hour later.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Time Expressions; Logical Progression

questions.text: He told his wife about it. The word "it" here means he found money in his garden.
questions.explanation: "It" refers to the event of finding coins in the garden.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Reference Words; Pronoun Reference

questions.text: There was a hole in his trousers.
questions.explanation: The hole was in his pocket.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

questions.text: ―How many coins did Tom dig out from the garden?―Only one.
questions.explanation: The text says Jim found coins, not Tom.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

question_sets.context:
Mr Smith had two sons .One is seven years old, and the other is five. One morning during the holidays, when he was cleaning the car, his younger son came and asked him for some money for sweets.
"Sweets are bad for your teeth," Mr Smith said. "Take these two oranges instead ,and give one to your elder(年长的)brother," One of the oranges is quite a lot bigger than the other one ,and as the small boy liked oranges very much, he kept that one for himself, and gave his brother the smaller one.
When the other boy saw that his brother had a much larger orange than his own ,he said to him, "It's selfish(自私的)to take the bigger one for yourself. If father had given me the oranges, I 'd have given you the bigger one."
"I know you would," answered his brother." That's why I took it."

questions.text: What was Mr Smith doing one morning?
questions.explanation: According to the context, this is what Mr. Smith doing one morning.

questions.text: What did his younger son ask for?
questions.answer: He asked for some money for sweets.
questions.explanation: According to the context, this is what younger son asked for.

questions.text: Did the son get what he wanted?
questions.explanation: According to the context, this is what the son got.

questions.text: Who got the bigger orange?
questions.explanation: According to the context, this is who got the bigger orange.

questions.text: Why did the elder brother say that his brother was selfish?
questions.answer: Because he kept the bigger orange for himself.
questions.explanation: According to the context, this is the reason why elder brother say that his brother was selfish.

question_sets.context: Mrs. Boffin is driving the car. Professor Boffin is sitting on the back seat. Mrs Boffin stops."You mustn't park here, dear," Professor Boffin says."Why not?" Mrs. Boffin asks"Because it says,'No Parking'" Professor Boffin answers."I don't care," Mrs. Boffin says."Wait for me here.""I'm going shopping now""And I'm going to sleep!" Professor Boffin says. The police take away the car, and they take Professor Boffin, too! He is fast asleep on the back seat!

question_sets.context:
Some days before Mother's Day, the teacher wanted to know how his students were going to show their love to their mothers. Some of the students came from far away to study here. "Are you going home to see your mother during the holiday?"the teacher asked one of them.
The student answered, "I have no time to go home because I'm going to get ready for the exam. But I'll write a letter to my mother."
"Then which do you think ismore important(更重要), your mother or the exam?"
"Of course the exam is more important,"answered the student."My mother is always saying so."

questions.text: All childrenshould(应该) show their love to their mother on Mother's Day.
questions.explanation: Implied from the teacher asking the students how they would show their love.

questions.explanation: The passage states that the student would write a letter to his mother, implying he does love her.

questions.text: The mother thought the exam was very important for her son.

question_sets.context:
"Next Tuesday is going to be a holiday," says the teacher. "I want you to tell me what you are going to do, Terra."
"I'm going to the movie theater to see a movie," says Terra. "It's a comedy about a fat professor. My classmates say it's really funny."
"Anything else you are going to do?" the teacher asks.
"Of course I'm going to do my lessons. I'm going to study math and physics in the morning."
"Do you like them?" the teacher asks.
"They are not easy for me. But I'm interested in them. I'm going to do my best to study them. I think this term I can do better than last term. "
"What are you going to do in the afternoon?" asks the teacher.
"After lunch, I'm going to play basketball with some classmates. Next month, we are going to have a match with Class One."

questions.text: There is going to be a holiday next Tuesday.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that "Next Tuesday is going to be a holiday."

questions.text: The movie is a comedy about a fat professor.
questions.explanation: Terra says, "It's a comedy about a fat professor."

questions.explanation: Terra says, "But I'm interested in them."

questions.text: Terra is going to play football with some classmates next Tuesday.
questions.explanation: Terra is going to play basketball with some classmates.

question_sets.context:
My grandpa was a sports fan. In 1996, the 26thOlympic Games were held in Atlanta, USA. One day,Grandpa watched a football match on TV. Suddenly he asid eagerly,"if only the Olympics would come to China, I could go to the stadium to watch it instead of on TV!"
Now beijing is bidding for the 2008 Olympic Games. Under the motto" new Beijing, great Olympics", millions of Chinese people have been involved in the bid. Students have planted trees and even the taxi drivers are busy learning English.
In 1993, Beijing lost to Sydney for the 2000 Olympics by only two votes. This time Beijing has succeeded, and I'm sure my grandpa would be very happy to see the games hosted in his own country,if he were still alive.
I think my grandpa's dream has come true. Moreover, it's not only my grandpa's dream, but also the Chinese people's dream.

questions.text: The writer's grandpa liked sports very much.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the writer's grandpa was a sports fan.

questions.text: The writer's grandpa is still alive now.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'if he were still alive', indicating he is deceased.

questions.text: The 27thOlympic Games were held in Sydney, Australia.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Beijing lost to Sydney for the 2000 Olympics.

questions.text: The taxi drivers are learning English because they want to earn more money.
questions.explanation: The passage says taxi drivers are learning English because Beijing is bidding for the Olympics.

questions.text: The old man's dream is also millions of Chinese people's dream.
questions.explanation: The passage states that it is also the Chinese people's dream.

question_sets.context: When David was playing in front of a big house, a man arrived. The man asked David, "Are your parents at home? I have a letter for them." David answered, "Yes. My father is watching TV and my mother is taking care of my little sister." The man rang the doorbell but no one answered the door. "Are they sleeping?" the man said to himself. The man tried again, but still no one answered. Then the man turned around and said to David, "You bad boy. You lied (说谎) to me! Your parents aren't at home." "I never lie," said David. "This is not my house!"

questions.text: David was playing behind a big house.
questions.explanation: David was playing in front of the house, not behind it.

questions.text: David's father was sleeping and his mother was watching TV.
questions.explanation: David's father was watching TV, and his mother was taking care of his little sister.

questions.text: The man rang the doorbell but nobody opened the door for him.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the man rang the doorbell, but no one answered.

questions.text: David lied to the man.
questions.explanation: David didn't lie because it wasn't his house.

questions.text: David didn't live in that big house.
questions.explanation: David explicitly stated that it was not his house.

question_sets.context: Do you know the word "laconic"? If you read the following story, you will know what the word means. Some of the people in the southern part of Greece were called Spartans. The name of their land was Laconia, and so they were sometimes called Lacons. One of the strange rules which the Spartans had was that they should use words as few as possible. And so a short answer was often given. In the northern part of Greece there was a land called Macedon. And this land at one time was ruled by a war-like king named Philip. He wanted to become the king of all Greece. So he made war on others, until nearly all of them were made to call him their king. Then he sent a letter to the Spartans in Laconia, saying, "If I go down into your country, I'll level your great city to the ground." In a few days an answer was brought to him. When he opened the letter, he found only one word written there. The word was: "If". It was as much as to say, "We are not afraid of you as long as the word 'if' stands in your way."

questions.text: Spartans could also be called Lacons.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the people in Laconia were sometimes called Lacons, and Spartans lived in Laconia.

questions.text: Spartans had a strange rule that they should always keep silence.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Spartans had a rule to use as few words as possible, not to always keep silence.

questions.text: Macedon was ruled by Philip.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Macedon was ruled by a war-like king named Philip.

questions.text: The reply word in the letter was "No".
questions.explanation: The passage states that the reply word in the letter was "If".

question_sets.context:
Today I got a good report from the school. In our school, each student gets a report at the end of the school year. Teachers of all subjects write their judgment (鉴定) about the subjects. Some of my classmates have got a good treat from their parents for their 'good reports', but I think mine is the best. I gave it to mum when I returned home. Mum was very happy to see it.
On English she wrote:
'Henry has made very good progress with his reading. He reads books of his own choice with absorption(吸收)and pleasure. He reads aloud fluently(流利的), with good expression and understanding. Henry listens very well to stories and poems. He participates() in class discussions expressing himself clearly.'
'Henry's written work (作文) is very good. He writes with a rounded(圆体子), clear joined handwriting using the basic rules of spelling and punctuation very well. The context of his writing is sound(完好的,合理).He has interesting ideas for stories, and is able to give factual accounts highlighting the important details of an event or visit.

questions.text: We Chinese students get a <blank> at the end of every school year.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, the blank should be filled with 'report'.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the blank should be filled with 'English'.

questions.text: From the report, we know Henry is good at r <blank>, l <blank> and w <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, the blank should be filled with 'reading, listening and writing'.

questions.text: Henry's written works have s <blank> contents and i <blank> ideas.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, the blank should be filled with 'sound, interesting'.

question_sets.context:
Ted worked in a factory in a big town. He liked fishing very much, and was very good at it. When he was free, he went down to the small river behind the factory and tried to catch some fish, but there were very few there, because the water was very dirty. Then one summer he went to the sea during his holidays and stayed at a small cheap hotel.
"I've never fished in the sea before," he thought, "It will be different from fishing in our river." On the first day he caught a lot of fish and was very happy. He gave them to the hotel and they cooked them for all the guests, and they enjoyed them very much. After that, he did that every day. But when Ted got his bill (账单) at the end of the week, he saw on it: For oil to cook the fish (7 days): 3.5dollars.

questions.text: Ted worked in an office in a big town.
questions.explanation: The passage clearly states that Ted worked in a factory, not an office.

questions.explanation: The passage says he gave the fish to the hotel, not sold.

questions.text: Ted stayed in the hotel for one week.
questions.explanation: The bill mentions "oil to cook the fish (7 days)", indicating that he stayed for a week.

There are also two big elephants and a baby one. Children like to ride on one of them. The elephants are kind. They eat much grass(草) and bananas. Elephants like bananas very much.

In the zoo there are also brown bears, black bears and white bears. They are all slow and clumsy(笨拙的). They stand on their back legs, lift their front legs to ask for food. They like cakes very much.

question_sets.context: Several summers ago, Joe Smith, a coach(教练) of a football team, and his family were spending their holidays in a small town. One rainy afternoon, it was impossible for them to go out to do something interesting, so the family decided to go to the cinema. Joe, his wife, and their three children walked soon to the town' s only cinema, bought tickets and went into the hall. The lights were still on, and there were just six other persons there. As Joe entered, some of them saw him and started clapping(鼓掌). Joe gave them a smile and turned to his wife."Aha, I can' t believe they know me and I' m getting a warm welcome here," he guessed."They saw my games on TV." They sat down and then a young man came back and gave out his hand."Thanks a lot,"said the coach."I just can' t believe you know who I am." "All I know,"replied the man."Is that they would not show the film until at least ten people bought tickets."

questions.text: Joe and his family couldn' t go out for anything funny that day because there was a wonderful film.
questions.explanation: The passage states they couldn't go out because it was a rainy afternoon, not because there was a wonderful film.

questions.text: When Joe and his family got to the cinema, the film didn' t begin to show.
questions.explanation: The passage says the lights were still on and there were only six other people there, indicating the film hadn't started.

questions.text: Joe was worried when some people warmly greeted him.
questions.explanation: Joe was initially pleased, thinking they recognized him from TV, not worried.

questions.text: Now with the coach' s family there were eleven people in the cinema.
questions.explanation: There were six people already there, and Joe's family consisted of five people (Joe, his wife, and three children), totaling eleven.

questions.text: In fact the people in the cinema clapped to the coach because they often saw him on TV.
questions.explanation: The young man explained they clapped because they needed more people to buy tickets before showing the film.

question_sets.context:
Mr and Mrs Brown lived in a small town near London with their child. Sometimes Mr Brown came back home from work very late, when his wife and the child were asleep, and then he opened the front door of this house with his key(钥匙)and came in very quiet.
But one night when he was coming home very late, he lost(丢)his key, so when he reached his house, he rang the bell. Nothing happened. He rang it again. Again nothing happened.
Nobody moved inside the house. Mr Brown knocked at(敲)the bedroom window, he spoke to his wife, he shouted, but she didn't wake up. At last he stopped and thought for a moment. Then he began to speak like a small child. ! Mother! "he said. ! I want to go to the toilet! "He spoke quite quietly but at once(立刻)Mrs Brown woke up. Then he spoke to her, and she opened the door for him.

questions.text: The Browns lived in a small town near London.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that the Browns lived in a small town near London.

questions.text: Mr Brown's wife and his child went to sleep after he came back from work.

questions.explanation: Mrs. Brown didn't wake up when she heard the bell rang.

question_sets.context: In the U.S. Mother's Day is a holiday on the second Sunday in May .It is a day when children give their mothers cards ,presents and flowers.One of the best ways to celebrate Mother's Day is to give your mother a day off. Let her have a good rest while other members of the family do the housework.Many families begin Mother's Day with breakfast in bed. Usually dad and the children will let mum sleep late as they go into the kitchen(厨房) and get ready for her favourite meal . A Mother's Day breakfast can be anything your mum likes.After the food is cooked ,keep everything nicely on a plate . Don't forget to put the bottle with only one flower. With spring here ,the children can pick up the nicest flower from the garden outside. When everything is ready ,carefully carry the plate and mum's favourite books or newspaper up to her bedroom .Cards and small presents from the children can be put on the plate before they are given to mum in bed.Many families take mum out to her favourite restaurant(饭店) for a meal. It is a good day to let your mum rest and let her see what a wonderful family she has.

questions.text: Mother's Day is on May 2nd.
questions.explanation: The passage says Mother's Day is on the second Sunday in May.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: It is the best way to let mum have a good rest on Mother's Day.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that one of the best ways to celebrate Mother's Day is to give your mother a day off, letting her rest.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Inference Skills

questions.text: After the nice breakfast is cooked, keep everything nicely for mum in a basket.
