questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

question_sets.context:
A city is a very big place. Sometimes it's a lonely place, too. There are thousands of people in a city, but some of them don't have any friends.
How about you? Do you have a lot of friends? If you don' t, make friends today. If you do, make another friend today.
Pick a stranger at your job or school. Walk up to him or her and say, "Hello. My name' s....What' s your name?" Start with a conversation(谈话).Smile, listen carefully, and show interest in your new friend' s answers. Ask "Where are you from?" and "Do you like this city?" That' s a good way to start.

questions.text: A city is a very big and noisy and lonely place.
questions.explanation: The text says 'A city is a very big place. Sometimes it's a lonely place, too'. So, A city is a very big and noisy and lonely place is true.

questions.text: Everyone in the city has many friends.
questions.explanation: The text says 'There are thousands of people in a city, but some of them don't have any friends.', so the answer should be false.

questions.explanation: The paragraph encourages us to make friends.

questions.text: When you wanted to make friends with someone, please say at first, "What' s your name? How old are you?"

questions.text: It' s a good thing to make friends with others.
questions.explanation: The text encourages us to make friends.

question_sets.context:
The Wilsons decided to go overseas for vacation. They had a family meeting(会议) to plan the vacation. "First," Mr Wilson said, "we should decide where we are going."
"I don't agree," Mrs Wilson said, "I think we should decide when we are going first. We don't want to go to places when they are cold." Mr Wilson agreed, so the family's first decision was when to go on vacation. They decided to go in July.
"Now we can decide where to go," said Mr Wilson.
"But, Dad," Ben said, "don't you think that where we go depends on how we go? If we plan to fly, we can go a long way. If we plan to drive, we can't go far."
Again, Mr Wilson agreed, and they discussed this. At last they agreed to travel by plane.
And so the planning meeting went on. The next day, one of Mr Wilson's friends at work asked, "Where are you going for vacation?"
"Well," Mr Wilson told him, "we are going in summer by plane, but I don't know where we are going!"

questions.text: Why did the Wilsons have a family meeting?
questions.explanation: They had the meeting to plan the vacation.

questions.text: What did they decide first?
questions.explanation: They decided when to go first.

questions.text: When did they decide to go?
questions.explanation: They decided to go in July.

questions.text: How did the Wilsons decide to travel?
questions.explanation: They decided to travel by plane.

questions.text: What they didn't decide?
questions.explanation: They didn't decide where to go.

question_sets.context:
Han Di lived in a city in the north. He wanted to visit some places in the south, but he didn't want to spend too much money.
Last summer he had a short vacation. He decided to take a trip to Hainan. He talked to a friend about his plan. His friend said,"If you go by plane, you'll get there in a few hours. Then you'll have more time for sightseeing. If you go by train, it'll take you four or five days to get there."
He left on June 14thand got back to work on the last day of the month. It took him more than two weeks to make the vacation. What was the matter? He went by ship for most of the vacation.

questions.text: He came back in June.

questions.text: It'll take a few days to travel from the north to the south by plane.

question_sets.context: Mr. Jones was very angry with his wife and she very angry with her husband. For a few days they didn't speak to each other. When she went up to bed much later than her husband, she found a piece of paper on the small table near her bed. On it were the words:"Father, wake up. It is 7a. m..-Mother".

question_sets.context: A man got into a train and found himself sitting opposite a woman who seemed to be about thirty-five years old. Soon they began talking to each other, and he said to her, “Do you have a family?” “Yes, I have one son,” the woman answered. “Oh really?” said the man. “Does he smoke?” “No, he's never touched a cigarette,” the woman replied. “That's good,” the man continued. “I don't smoke, either. Cigarette is very bad for people. And does your son drink wine?” “Oh, no,” the woman answered at once. “He's never drunk a drop of it.” “Then I congratulate you, madam,” the man said. “And does he ever come home late at night?” “No, never,” his neighbor answered. “He goes to bed immediately after dinner every night.” “Well,” the man said. “He's a wise young man. How old is he?” “He is six months old today,” the woman replied proudly.

questions.text: The woman seemed to be about 45 years old.
questions.explanation: The passage states the woman seemed to be about thirty-five years old, not 45.

questions.text: The man smoked a lot.
questions.explanation: The man said he doesn't smoke.

questions.text: The man went to bed late every night.
questions.explanation: The passage describes the woman's son going to bed early, not the man.

questions.text: The woman's son was only 7 months old.
questions.explanation: The woman's son was six months old.

question_sets.context:
"Tom? Are you in bed yet?"called Mrs White. There was no answer. Mrs White put down her book and went to her 14-year-old son' s room. Tom was sitting in front of a bright computer screen on which a colorful dragon(龙) jumped and shouted.
"Oh, Tom! You' re still playing on that computer. You must stop now, it' s half past eleven. If you don' t go to bed soon, you' ll be very tired tomorrow,"said Mrs White.
"But I' ve nearly beaten the dragon,"said Tom. Mrs White could see the excitement(激动) on her son' s face. She sat down beside him.
"You are always playing on that computer. You spend more time with this machine than with your family," she said with a smile."What' s so special(特别的) about it? Show me what it can do!"
Tom was very excited."I think this is a very good computer, Mum!"he said happily."There' s so much memory(内存) and it has some wonderful software programmes. This game, Dragonsplayer, is my favourite, but I sometimes borrow games from Danny and other friends. I don' t have to worry about any infected(被感染的) disks(磁盘) because I have a virus(病毒) detector(监测器) which can go over any disk and check it for viruses. Let me show you!"Tom began tapping(敲打) keys on the keyboard(键盘).The screen changed in answer to his orders(命令).
"Oh, Tom," laughed Mrs White,"I' m sure it' s a wonderful computer, but I' m afraid I don' t know what you' re talking about."

questions.text: When Mrs White was calling Tom, he was lying in bed reading.
questions.explanation: The text says Tom was sitting in front of a computer screen, not lying in bed reading.

questions.text: This story happened after Tom had slept for some hours in the evening.
questions.explanation: The story takes place at half past eleven, before Tom has gone to bed.

questions.text: Tom was very excited because he had nearly beaten the dragon in the computer.
questions.explanation: Tom said, "But I've nearly beaten the dragon," showing his excitement.

questions.text: Tom liked playing computer games very much.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates Tom spends a lot of time playing computer games and enjoys them.

questions.text: Tom didn' t want to talk about the computer with his mother.
questions.explanation: Tom was excited to show his mother the computer and its features.

question_sets.context:
One day a poor man was cutting a big piece of wood (木头) near a river. Suddenly his old axe (斧子) fell into the water. He felt very sad because he lost his only axe. Then all at once a beautiful fairy (仙女) came out and asked the man what the was matter.
"I have lost my axe." he said, "It fell into the water when I was cutting the wood."
The fairy showed him a gold axe and asked, "Is that yours?"
"No." said the man.
The fairy then showed him a silver (银) axe and asked again, "Is this yours?"
"No." again answered the man.
Then she showed him the old axe.
"Yes, that is mine." called out the happy man.
"I know it well enough." said the fairy, "I only wanted to see if you would tell me the truth, and now I'll give you the gold axe and the silver axe besides (包括) your own one."

questions.text: The man was poor, he had nothing but an old axe.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that the man was poor.

questions.text: The old axe fell into the river when the man was cutting the wood.
questions.explanation: The text explicitly states this.

questions.text: The fairy asked the man if he lost a gold axe, then the man said "No".
questions.explanation: The fairy first asked about the gold axe, and the man said no.

questions.text: When he saw his own axe, the man was very happy.
questions.explanation: The passage uses the word 'happy'.

questions.text: At last, the man had two axes.
questions.explanation: He had three axes in the end, gold, silver and his own.

question_sets.context:
Fan Hua is a TV presenter. He is asking Raja what he thinks about family life.
F: Well, Raja, would you like to begin? Is family life in Shanghai different that in your country?
R: Yes, I think so. I can see some difference.
F: Oh, like what?
R: Well, the family seems to be smaller here than in my country. For you, the family is only mum, dad and child.
F: How about yours?
R: Ours have a more extended(扩大的) family.
F: Really?
R: Yes. In Pakistan, we usually have grandparents, uncles, aunts, brothers or sisters living in a big family.
F: I see, and you look after old family members yourselves, don't you?
R: Right.
F: It is the same as that in China's countryside and remote areas(乡村与边远地区). Oh yes, do you like the family life here in China?
R: Yes, I enjoy it very much, but I also enjoy ours.

questions.text: Raja is from America.
questions.explanation: Raja is from Pakistan.

questions.text: The young people look after the old family members in Raja's country.
questions.explanation: Raja says "and you look after old family members yourselves, don't you?".

questions.text: In the family life in China's countryside, we always have mum, dad and child.
questions.explanation: China's countryside is like Raja's country.

questions.text: The family is smaller in China than that in Raja's country.
questions.explanation: Raja says "the family seems to be smaller here than in my country."

questions.text: Raja doesn't like family life in China.
questions.explanation: Raja says "Yes, I enjoy it very much, but I also enjoy ours."

question_sets.context: A man was walking through (穿过) a forest. He had a few cap in his hand. In the forest there were a lot of monkeys. The day washot, so he wanted to have a rest under a tree. He put one cap on hishead and lay down (躺下) to sleep. When he woke up, he couldn't find his caps. He looked up andsaw some monkeys in the tree, each had a cap on its head. The man was very clever. He wanted his caps back, so he took off (摘下) his cap and threw it on the ground (地面). The littlemonkeys did the same. He picked up all the caps and went away.

question_sets.context: English people have porridge for breakfast, too. But their porridge is made of oats(燕麦), not rice. When you go to an English family for tea, the host(男主人) or hostess always asks you, \"How many lumps(方块) of sugar do you want in your tea?\""BIn ordinary English families, the main meal is in the evening, because most of the families are away during the day. question_sets.context: The train I was travelling on was already half an hour late. I had to arrive in Vienna at 7:15 in time to catch the 7: 25 train to Paris, but there was no hope of that now. I told the conductor about it. He advised(建议)me to get off two stops before Vienna station and take a taxi. When the time come, the conductor eyen helped me with my bags. He wished me good luck as I jumped off. And a few minutes later, I was racing towards the centre of the city in a taxi. It was almost 7: 25 when we stopped outside the station. I paid the driver quickly, took hold of my bags quickly and hurried inside. "Paris train" was all I had time to say to the official(铁路职员)I saw. You can guess how I feel when he pointed to a train that was just moving out of the station.

questions.text: Where did the writer want to go?
questions.answer: He wanted to go to Paris.
questions.explanation: The first paragraph says that he needs to arrive in Vienna in time to catch the train to Paris.

questions.text: Was there enough(足够的)time for him to catch the 7∶25 train to Paris?
questions.explanation: The first sentence says that there was no hope of that now.

questions.text: Where did the writer get off the train?
questions.answer: He got off two stops before Vienna.
questions.explanation: The conductor advised him to get off two stops before Vienna station.

questions.text: How did he get to Vienna after he got off the train?
questions.explanation: He took a taxi to race to the centre of the city.

questions.text: Was he happy or sad at the end of the story?
questions.explanation: The last sentence says that the train was moving out of the station.

question_sets.context: A few years ago, I went to London for the first time. One day I wanted to go to a park, so I got on a bus by myself. When the bus got to the shop near the park, I wanted to get off. I stood up and rang the bell twice, but the bus didn’t stop. The conductor came and shouted at me. I got off at the next stop. I heard someone say, “I think he’s a foreigner.” Later I learned from my friend that only the conductor could ring the bell twice. That means no one is getting off at the stop.

question_sets.context:
Wang Lan and Wang Jing are students from Shanghai. They are sisters. They are looking for a new place to live in. They need to catch buses and trains every day. They can pay 375 yuan a week.
Wang Lan is 24 years old, and she is studying computer science. She goes to university every weekday and sometimes on Saturdays. She usually studies every night and she doesn't go out very often. She has a lot of books and a large desk. A quiet place is what she wants to live in.
Wang Jing is 19 years old. She is studying English at a language college. She has classes from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. After that she often plays badminton with her best friend at the college. Sometimes they go shopping. In the evening, she usually watches TV or studies with her friend. Sometimes they go to the cinema.

question_sets.context: People are so busy these days that many people have no time to cook. This becomes a problem, because most families love home cooking! The food tastes good and warm, and a family meal brings everyone together. In some families, meals are often the only times everyone sees one another at the same time. Another reason(原因) people enjoy home cooking is that it is often a way of showing love. A parent who makes some cookies is not just satisfying(满足) a child's sweet tooth. she or he is sending a message. The message says, "I care about you enough to spend an hour making cookies that you will eat up in 15 minutes if I let you." There is also something about the smell of home cooking. The smell of home cooking pleases peoples of all ages. It makes most of us feel happy �C even if(即使) we are the ones doing the cooking!

questions.text: Now fewer people cook because most of them dislike home cooking.
questions.explanation: Most families love home cooking, it's just that they don't have time to cook.

questions.text: A parent spends an hour making cookies just to satisfy her or his child's sweet tooth.
questions.explanation: A parent sends a message of love by making cookies.

questions.text: The writer thinks the smell of home cooking makes us happy.
questions.explanation: The smell of home cooking makes most of us feel happy.

questions.text: Meals often bring many people together then they can see one another at the same time.
questions.explanation: Meals often bring many people together then they can see one another at the same time.

questions.text: This passage mainly(主要) tells us that family meals are important.
questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes the importance of family meals.

question_sets.context:
Many teenagers feel that the most important people in their lives are their friends. They believe that their family members, and particularly(尤其) their parents, don't know them as well as their friends do. In large families, it is quite often for brothers and sisters to fight with each other and then they can only go to their friends for advice.

It is very important for teenagers to have one good friend or a circle(圈)of friends. Even when they are not with their friends, they usually spend a lot of time talking among(在……中间) themselves on the phone. This communication(交际) is very important in children's growing up, because friends can discuss something difficult to say to their family members.

However, parents often try to choose their children's friends for them. Some parents may even stop(阻止) their children from meeting their good friends.

questions.text: Many teenagers think their friends know them better than their parents.
questions.explanation: The passage says teenagers believe their friends know them better.

questions.text: When teenagers have problems in family, maybe they will go to ask their teacher for advice.
questions.explanation: The passage says they go to their friends for advice.

questions.text: Brothers and sisters in a family get on well.
questions.explanation: The passage says brothers and sisters often fight.

questions.text: Teenagers often write to their friends when they're alone.
questions.explanation: The passage says they spend time talking on the phone.

questions.text: Not all the parents let their children choose everything they like.
questions.explanation: The passage says parents try to choose their children's friends.

question_sets.context:
A good breakfast is important. You can easily understand it. By breakfast time you haven't eaten anything for about 12 hours. Your body needs food for morning activies.
One good breakfast should be rice or bread, an egg, milk and fruit. On a cold morning a cup of hot drink is very necessary(必需的).
You must get up early to have enough time to eat breakfast.
A good breakfast helps you to smile more easily. It helps you to be more friendly and to work better and play more happily. Your whole day will be more fun after you have enjoyed a good breakfast.

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that a good breakfast is important.

questions.text: Getting up late is good for having breakfast.

question_sets.context:
April Fools' Day is on April 1st. People can play jokes on others on this special day. If you succeed, you usually laugh and say "April Fool!" The person fooled by you laughs too, and he will not be angry with you.
Mother's Day is on the second Sunday of May. It's a day to thank mothers. On that day mothers usually get flowers and cards from their children. Fathers and children do the housework so that mothers can have a good rest.
Easter Day falls on the first Sunday after the full moon which is on or after March 21st. It's also called Easter Sunday. It is said that on that day Jesus Christ comes back to life. Many people go to church and children often get presents such as toy rabbits.
Thanksgiving Day is on the fourth Thursday in November. It's a day when people give thanks for the good things in life. Usually families get together and have a big dinner.
Christmas Day comes on December 25th. It's the most important festival in a year. The beautiful things are everywhere. People exchange presents, send Christmas cards and visit friends.

questions.text: You can play jokes on others on April Fools'Day.
questions.explanation: According to the first paragraph, people can play jokes on others on April Fools' Day.

questions.text: Mother's Day is on the second Saturday in May.
questions.explanation: According to the second paragraph, Mother's Day is on the second Sunday in May.

questions.text: Easter Day is always on March 21st.
questions.explanation: According to the third paragraph, Easter Day falls on the first Sunday after the full moon which is on or after March 21st.

questions.text: People usually have a big dinner with their families on Thanksgiving Day.
questions.explanation: According to the fourth paragraph, people usually have a big dinner with their families on Thanksgiving Day.

questions.text: Fathers must do the housework on Mother's Day.
questions.explanation: According to the second paragraph, Fathers and children do the housework on Mother's Day.

question_sets.context:
Dear John,
Thank you very much for your letter. I am glad that you enjoyed our holiday with me. We enjoyed having you and your sister here. We hope that you will both be able to come again next year. Perhaps you'll be able to stay longer next time. A week is not really long enough, is it? If your school has five weeks' holiday next year, perhaps you will be able to stay with us for two or three weeks.
We have been back at school three weeks now. It feels like three months! I expect that you are both working very hard now because you are in Grade Two now. Tom and Ann won't be in Grade Two until 2005. They went for a picnic yesterday but I didn't go with them, because I hurt my foot and I couldn't walk very well. They went to an island and enjoyed themselves there.
Tom, Ann and I send our best wishes to you. We hope to see you soon.
Yours,
Michael

questions.text: Who stayed with Michael for a holiday?
questions.answer: John and his sister stayed with Michael for a holiday.

questions.text: How long did their holiday last for?
From the sentence "It feels like three months!", we know that Michael has no interest in learning, right?
Who will be in Grade Two next year?
questions.answer: Tom and Ann will be in Grade Two next year.

questions.text: Why didn't Michael go to the island for a picnic yesterday?

His meat goes down into the river.

question_sets.context:
When the Americans were getting ready to send their first men  to the moon, an old Irishman(爱尔兰人) was watching them on TV in the bar of a hotel. There was an Englishman in the bar, too, and he said to the Irishman,"The Americans are very clever, aren't they? They are going to send some men to the moon. It's a long way from our world."
"Oh, that's nothing," the Irishman answered quickly."The Irish are going to send .some men to the sun in a few months' time. That's much farther away than the moon, you know."
The Irishman laughed and answered, "Well, the Irish aren't foolish, you know. We won't go to the sun during the day, of course. We'll go there during the night,"

questions.text: An old Irishman was watching the Americans sending their first men to the moon.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'an old Irishman was watching them on TV'.

questions.text: The Americans aren't very clever, are they? No, they aren't.
questions.explanation: The text says 'The Americans are very clever, aren't they?' which implies they are clever, and the answer 'No, they aren't.' is wrong.

questions.text: It's farther to get to the moon than to get to the sun.
questions.explanation: The Irishman says, 'That's much farther away than the moon, you know.' referring to the sun.

questions.text: The sun isn't cool enough for us to go to.
questions.explanation: This can be inferred because the Irishman says they will go to the sun at night.

questions.text: The Americans are cleverer than the Irish.
questions.explanation: This is an inference based on the Englishman's statement and the Irishman's humorous reply.

question_sets.context:
In England, people don't usually talk very much. You can go on a bus, or in a train, and everyone sits looking out of the windows. Often they read. They read books and papers. But they don't talk much.
When you meet English people, they often talk about one thing ― the weather. So when you meet someone in England, you can say, "Nice weather for the time of year." "But it was a little cold yesterday," someone may answer. "But it got a bit warmer later!" you can say. If you talk like this, the English will think, "How friendly you are!"

question_sets.context:
Hello, everyone. Here is something important for everyone going to London next
month. As you know, you are going to stay with a family for two weeks. Now, the most important thing is money. You should take about $530 with you. I think it
will be enough for everyone. Then, when you arrive, your new family will meet you. You must remember to wear a red shirt, so the family will find you easily. They've been told you all wear red shirts. You'll also need to take with you 4 photos of yourself and, of course, it's very important that you take the school letter. While you're there, if you have any problems, you can call Leech School Office. I'll give you the office phone number now: it's 580-4436 and the person to ask for is Mr. s Belcher…She's in the office from nine o'clock in the morning until five in the afternoon every day. OK. That's everything. Have a good journey!

question_sets.context:
One rainy day a woman with a dog got on the bus. It was a big dog and its feet were very dirty. The woman sat down and the dog stood near her. When the conductor came up to her, she said, "Oh, conductor, I pay for my dog, can he have a seat like the other passengers(乘客)?"
The conductor looked at the dog and its dirty feet and then he said, "Of course, madam. He can have a seat like all the other passengers, but like all the other passengers, he must not put his feet on it."

question_sets.context:
An old porter (搬运工) had been working for the railway for a very long time. He was standing in one of the big railway station in London one morning, waiting for travelers (旅行者) to ask him to help them with their luggage (行李) when he saw a small man running toward the trains, carrying a bag.
The porter watched the man for a few seconds, and then the man saw the porter. At once he ran up to him and said, "Can I catch the 10:35 train to Newcastle--on―Tyne, porter?" He was breathing (呼吸) very fast, and he looked worried.
The old porter looked at him for a moment and then said politely (有礼貌地), "Well, sir, I'd like to help you, but I can't answer your question, because I don't know how fast you can run along rails, you see, "he explained (解释), "the 10:35 train to Newcastle―on―Tyne left five minutes ago."

questions.text: The small man was not a porter. He was a passenger.
questions.explanation: The passage describes the small man as asking about catching a train, indicating he is a passenger.

questions.text: The small man was running because he was carrying a heavy bag.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions the man was carrying a bag, but doesn't say it's the reason he was running. The man was running because he was late for the train.

questions.text: The passenger wanted to go to Newcastle-on-Tyne.
questions.explanation: The man asked if he could catch the train to Newcastle-on-Tyne.

questions.text: The old porter knew that the small man could not catch the train.
questions.explanation: The porter stated the train had already left five minutes ago.

questions.text: The small man got to the station at twenty to eleven.
questions.explanation: The train was scheduled for 10:35 and had already left 5 minutes prior, so the small man arrived at 10:40.

question_sets.context: Yesterday morning Paul said to himself, “I have to write that math paper today.” He sat down at his desk and put a piece of paper into his typewriter. He looked out of the window, ate a piece of bread, got up to get a drink of water, brushed his teeth, and sat down at his desk again. “I haven't written to my family since Christmas,” he said to himself. “My typewriter needs a new ribbon. I have to change this ribbon before I write my math paper.” The water from the typewriter ribbon got his hand very dirty, so he washed them. While he was washing his hands, he saw that his fingernails were much too long. He cut them very carefully and then went back to his desk. He put a piece of paper into his typewriter, looked out of the window, and looked at his watch. It was almost noon. “I'll get some lunch now,” he said to himself. “After lunch I'll write that paper, if I don't do anything else.”

questions.text: Paul was going to write a paper on method of teaching.

questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: First he washed his hands, then he ate some bread.

question_sets.context:
One day Tom's mother looked at his shoes and said,"Tom ,look at your shoes. How dirty they are! You must clean them ."
"Oh, Mum, but I cleaned them only yesterday."Said the boy.
"They are dirty now. You must clean them again."
"I don't want to clean them today. If I clean then today, They will be dirty again tomorrow."
Tom's mother thought for a while and said,"OK, don't do that then."In the evening, Tom came back from school. He was very hungry.
"Mum, give me something to eat, please."He said.
"You had your breakfast in the morning, Tom and had lunch at school,"his mother said.
"I'm hungry again."Cried the boy.
"Oh, hungry ? But if I give you something to eat today, you'll be hungry again tomorrow."

question_sets.context: Two men were traveling in the mountain part of America. For some time, they had not seen any houses except a few wooden huts. One day they met an old Indian who lived there. They found he knew their language and they had a talk with him. One of them asked him whether he could tell them what the weather would be like within the next few days. "Oh, yes," he said, "Rain is coming, and also wind. Then there will be snow for two days, but after that there Will be a fine day." To their surprise, the old Indian could exactly foretell the weather. What a wise man! Then one of them turned to the old man, and asked, "How did you know all that?" The Indian answered, "I heard it on the radio."

question_sets.context:
I am sure you know the song "Happy Birthday". But do you know who wrote this song and for whom it was written?
Let me tell you the story.
One hundred and three years ago, there were two sisters in the USA. They loved children very much and wrote many songs for children. One of them was the well－known "Good Morning to You!" It was very popular at that time among children, but not many grown－ups knew it.
A few years later on their nephew, Archibald's birthday party, the two sisters sang the song "Happy Birthday" to the melody of "Good Morning to You" to their nephew.
The two sisters had never thought this song would become so popular, but it really did. People all over the world like the song because of its simplicity and friendliness in words.

questions.text: The song came from the melody "Good Morning to You."
questions.explanation: The passage clearly states that "Happy Birthday" was sung to the melody of "Good Morning to You".

question_sets.context: Traditional Chinese doctors believe we need a balance of yin and yang to be healthy. For example, are you often weak and tired? Maybe you have too much yin. You should eat hot yang foods, like beef. Eating Dangshen and Huangqi herbs is also good for this. But people who are too stressed out and angry may have too much yang. Chinese doctors believe that they should eat more yin foods like tofu. Chinese medicine is now popular in many western countries. It's easy to have a healthy lifestyle, and it's important to eat a balanced diet.

questions.text: You should eat foods like beef when you are often weak and tired.
questions.explanation: According to the text, if you are often weak and tired, you may have too much yin and should eat hot yang foods, like beef.

questions.text: Eating Dangshen and Huangqi herbs is also good for having much yin.
questions.explanation: According to the text, Eating Dangshen and Huangqi herbs is also good for having much yang.

questions.text: You are too stressed out and angry maybe you have too much yin.
questions.explanation: According to the text, if you are too stressed out and angry, maybe you have too much yang.

questions.text: Beef and tofu are yang foods.
questions.explanation: According to the text, beef is a yang food, but tofu is a yin food.

questions.text: To eat a balanced diet is important.
questions.explanation: The text says that it's important to eat a balanced diet.

question_sets.context:
A Talking Fish
One afternoon last summer,Mr Stow went to a fishman to buy fish for his supper, because a friend of his would come to have supper with him that evening.
It was hot, and most of the fish were not so good,but the fishman said, " Sir, all of my fish good and fresh(新鲜的),buy one ?" Mr Stow held one fish up to his nose and smelled it. "Why do you smell that fish!Do you think it bad?" asked the fishman. "No,I didn't smell it ." "Then what did you do with your face so close to the fish ?"asked the fishman. "I didn't smell the fish.I only talked to it ."said Mr Stow . "What did the fish say to you?" "He said he didn't know the latest news, because he wasn't in the river for more than a week."

questions.text: Did the story happen last year?
questions.explanation: The story happened last summer, not last year. The exact year is not mentioned.

questions.text: Why did Mr Stow want to buy fish for his supper?
questions.explanation: because a friend of his would come to have supper with him that evening.

questions.text: What was the weather like that day?
questions.explanation: It was hot.

questions.text: Do you think Mr Stow bought the fish? Why?
questions.explanation: Since he talked to fish, I think he bought the fish.

questions.text: Was the fishman glad when heard what Mr Stow said?
questions.explanation: The fishman was confused when he heard Mr Stow said.

question_sets.context:
The world is divided into two main parts. One is rich and the other is poor. In the poor part, a lot of people never get enough to eat. In the rich part, a lot of people eat too much. In one part, children starve and in the other, a lot of people get fatter and fatter and have to go on diet or do special exercises in order to lose weight.
The poor countries have special problems. Sometimes the land is too poor to grow anything on. The land can be improved,but a lot of things must be done first. People must be educated,and water must be found. But rich countries have problems,too. For example,sometimes the air is too dirty to breathe,and the rivers are too dirty to swim in or to take water from. The roads are too crowded to drive along. Large numbers of people do not have decent houses to live in. Some things will have to be done about these problems. The air and the rivers will have to be cleaned,and more houses will have to be built.

questions.text: In the writer's opinion, the world is divided into two parts: the rich and the poor.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that the world is divided into two main parts: rich and poor.

questions.text: Rich countries and poor countries both have problems.
questions.explanation: The passage discusses problems in both rich and poor countries, such as starvation in poor countries and pollution in rich countries.

questions.text: In poor countries, the land can't be improved.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the land can be improved in poor countries, but a lot of things must be done first.

questions.text: In rich countries, most people don't have decent houses to live in.
questions.explanation: The passage states that large numbers of people do not have decent houses to live in rich countries.

question_sets.context:
A boy named Jack lived in a small village.One morning,his mother sent him to his uncle's in town.He had a very good time there.
Before Jack left in the evening,his uncle gave him a jar and said, "There is some candy in it,you may put your hand into it and take some when you want to eat something."
Jack looked at the jar when he was in the train.It had a long and small neck.He put his hand into the jar and took five pieces.But he could not get his hand out.He turned his hand this way and that way,still he could not get his hand out.He turned his hand again.Finally he let go of four pieces.Then he could pull his hand out of the jar.

questions.text: One day Jack's mother sent him to his mother's brother's house.
questions.explanation: Jack's uncle is his mother's brother.

questions.text: The jar with some candy in it had a large neck.
questions.explanation: The jar had a long and small neck.

questions.text: Jack only stayed in town for a whole day.
questions.explanation: He went in the morning and left in the evening.

questions.text: At last Jack only took one piece of candy at a time.
questions.explanation: He let go of four pieces, so he took one at a time.

questions.text: From this lesson,Jack knew that he himself was too foolish.
questions.explanation: The story implies Jack was foolish for taking too many candies.

question_sets.context: Many people like animals: children like animals best. Usually we can only see dogs, cats, ducks, or chickens. We can't see other animals such as elephants, tigers, pandas, and monkeys. On Sunday, parents often take their children to the zoo. How happy the children are! They run from one place to another. They give animals all kinds of good food to eat. They stay there one hour after another. They don't want to go home. Children always have a good time there.

question_sets.context:
Deat Anna,
In your last letter you asked me my plans for the future. First I will finish high school. Then I will go to college and study to be a doctor. I will not get married (结婚) right away because it takes a long time to become a docotor. I want to help sick people. I am going to learn a lot about illnesses. Maybe I will find a treatment for cancer( 癌症). I will be famous and I will be very rich.
After I become a very successful doctor, I will get married. I want to marry an interesting person. For example, my wife might be an artist. We will have a womderful life together. I think we will have one or two children. Doctors get paid quite a lot so I think we will have a nice house. We will travel a lot. I want to visit Australia, Europe and Africa.
Are these plans , or dreams? Do they sound crazy to you? Write soon and tell me about your plans.
Your friend,
John

question_sets.context: John was a bookseller and he didn't like paying for(付钱) anything. One day a big box of books fell on his foot and hurt it. "Go to the doctor," said his wife. "No," he said. "I'll wait till the doctor comes next time. Then I'll ask him about my foot. If I go to see him, I'll have to pay him." A few days later, the doctor came into the bookshop and bought some books. When John was getting ready, he told the doctor about his bad foot. The doctor looked at it. "Yes," said the doctor. "You must put that foot in hot water every night." "Thank you." Said the bookseller. "And now, here are your books "" How much?" asked the doctor. "Twenty dollars(美元), please," answered John "Good," said the doctor, "I'll not have to pay you anything." "Why?" asked John in surprise(惊讶地). "I told you something about your foot, I want 20 dollars for that. Goodbye!"

Mr Cooper worked at a school. He was the headmaster of a school for boys. I thought he was a kind man because he told me funny stories. But I was sure the boys were afraid of him.

question_sets.context:
Sports change with the season. People do not often play the same games in winter as in summer. Sailing is fun in warm weather, but when it gets cold, it's time to change to other sports. People talk about sports seasons. Baseball is only played for a few months of the year. This is called "baseball season".
Games and sports often grow out of the working people. In Portugal(葡萄牙) many people work to catch fish. They fish from boats. Sometimes they use their boats for racing.
Arabians(阿拉伯人) are famous for their horses. They use horses to travel over huge plains(平原). Horseback riding is a very exciting sport in countries like Morocco(摩洛哥). When men ride horses at greet speeds, they often stand up.

questions.text: People play the same games in winter as in summer.
questions.explanation: The first sentence directly states that sports change with the season, implying that people don't play the same games in winter as in summer.

questions.text: Games and sports are often created (创造) by the working people.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that "Games and sports often grow out of the working people."

questions.text: Arabians are famous for racing boats.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Arabians are famous for their horses, not boats.

questions.text: People in Morocco like riding horses.
questions.explanation: The passage says that Horseback riding is a very exciting sport in countries like Morocco.

questions.text: Sports change with the season.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that "Sports change with the season."

question_sets.context:
The best-known vegetable in the world is the potato. It grows in many places and doesn't need as rich soil as many other crops. But until four hundred years ago the potato was not known to Europeans. But today is one of the main foods in Europe.
In France the potato was not grown for food for a long time. A story is told about Louis. In 1778 he saw some potato flowers for the first time. He liked them so much that he picked one and put it in his buttonhole. He was interested in the flowers not the potatoes themselves.

questions.text: Potatoes are grown and eaten in Europe.
questions.explanation: The passage states that potatoes are one of the main foods in Europe today, implying they are grown and eaten there.

questions.text: The potato grows well only in the rich soil.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the potato doesn't need as rich soil as many other crops, implying it doesn't grow only in rich soil.

questions.text: A Frenchman Louis was the first man to eat potatoes in Europe.
questions.explanation: The passage doesn't say Louis was the first to eat potatoes, only that he saw potato flowers and liked them.

questions.text: At first the Europeans grew potatoes to eat.
questions.explanation: The passage says that in France, potatoes were not grown for food for a long time, implying Europeans didn't grow them to eat at first.

questions.text: Louis put the potato flowers in his buttonhole because he liked them very much.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Louis liked the flowers so much he put one in his buttonhole.

question_sets.context:
CATV is short for "community antenna(公用天线) television". But "cable television" is the name most people like to use. Cable television can help people receive TV programs that they can not get with theirordinary(常规) antenna.
Televisionsignals(信号) travel in straight lines in all directions. Signals from a TV station move towards thehorizon(地平线) and then go into space. If people live only a few miles from a TV station, they may get a good picture on their televisions. But if they live more than 50 miles from a station, they may not get good pictures.
CATV began in 1948. People in places far from TV stations had to pay for it. A community antenna was usually placed on a hill, a mountain or on a high tower. The antenna can receive TV signals and send them into a smalllocalstation(当地电视台).
Today, cable television is used in more and more areas. It is even used in many classrooms all over the country.

questions.text: Most people like using the name of "cable television".
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that most people like to use 'cable television'.

questions.text: TV signals travel in curved lines.
questions.explanation: The passage states that TV signals travel in straight lines.

questions.text: People who live more than 50 miles from a station mustn't get any pictures at all.
questions.explanation: The passage indicates that they 'may not get good pictures', not necessarily 'any pictures at all'.

questions.text: The antenna sends TV signals to local station.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the antenna can receive TV signals and send them into a small local station.

questions.text: The cable television can also be used in classrooms today.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that cable television is used in many classrooms all over the country.

question_sets.context:
Most people sleep at night, but Frank sleeps during the day and works at night. His work is toguard(看守) a large factory. He is lonely because nobody there talks with him in the evening.
Frank likes his work. He knows that it is important to guard the factory at night. If he hears any noise, he goes quickly to see what it is. Most of the time he walks around inside the big building, but he also walks around outside. When he is tired, he can sit on a chair by the door. It is very cold in winter. He always wears a warm coat when he is working.
One night when Frank went outside, he heard a noise near a dark corner of the factory. He went very quietly towards the noise to see if someone was there, but he only saw a small dog. Frank smiled and talked to the dog. It looked cold and sad. He took the dog inside the building, and the happy dog followed him around. During the rest of the night Frank was not lonely. A dog was a good friend for him.

questions.text: Frank sleeps at night and works in the day.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that Frank sleeps during the day and works at night.

questions.text: Frank doesn't think his job is important.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Frank knows that it is important to guard the factory at night.

questions.text: Sometimes Frank walks around outside the big building.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly says that he also walks around outside.

questions.text: One night Frank saw a little dog sleeping at the gate of the factory.
questions.explanation: Frank saw the dog near a dark corner of the factory, not sleeping at the gate.

questions.text: Frank took the dog home at once.
questions.explanation: Frank took the dog inside the building, not home.

question_sets.context:
The Scotch are not the only economical (节俭的) people in the world. The Japanese run them a close second.
Two Japanese were talking about their fans, "My fan," said the first one, "has lasted for twenty years. And this is how I managed it: I had it made in four sections and each five years I opened only one of the sections."
"That is nothing," replied the other one scornfully (轻蔑的) , "My fan has lasted a life-time. I open it wide and hold it motionless (不动的) under my nose. Then I wave my head."

questions.text: Here's a talk between two clever men.
questions.explanation: The men's behavior doesn't imply they are clever, they are just economical.

questions.text: The Japanese are as economical as the Scotch.
questions.explanation: The first sentence indicates the Japanese are almost as economical as the Scotch.

questions.text: The two men are selling fans now.
questions.explanation: The passage doesn't say they are selling fans.

questions.text: The men are very poor to use one fan.
questions.explanation: The passage suggests they are economical, not poor.

questions.text: People in Japan can open fans once five years.
questions.explanation: One of the men opens a section of his fan every five years, but not all people in Japan.

question_sets.context: Charlie sheen ,a famous actor made his first film at age 9.in his dads TV movie. When he was young ,he was an unhappy student at Santa Monica School .his only interest was in his school baseball team .he was kicked off because he often missed the practices .later he player ball at the Mickey Owens  Baseball Camp .he played very well. And he used his  skill of playing ball in the films later. In the film "Eight Men Out" and "Major League", he played the role of a baseball player.

questions.text: Charlie sheen , a famous actor.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states 'Charlie Sheen, a famous actor'.

questions.text: He made his first film at age 9.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'Charlie Sheen...made his first film at age 9'.

questions.text: He liked school very much, so he was a happy boy.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'he was an unhappy student'.

questions.text: He was in school basketball team.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'his only interest was in his school baseball team'.

questions.text: He became famous later and he played the role of a basketball player in the film.
questions.explanation: He played the role of a baseball player in the film.

question_sets.context: Many years ago , an English family were living in China . One evening an important Chinese officer came to visit them . It got later and later , and he still did not go , so his hostess ( 女主人 ) invited ( 邀请 ) him to have dinner with them . But she had very little food in the house , so she quickly went to the kitchen and spoke to her Chinese cook . He said , "It's all right . You'll have a good dinner . "When they all sat down to eat , the lady was very surprised , because there was a lot of very good food on the table .After the dinner , the hostess ran to the kitchen and said to the cook . "How did you make such a good meal in half an hour ? " ."I did not make it , madam , "he said "I sent one of the servants to the Chinese officer's house , and he brought back the Chinese officer's dinner . "

questions.text: An English Lady invited a Chinese officer to have dinner with her family .
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that the hostess invited the officer for dinner.

questions.text: The lady had quite a lot of food in her house .
questions.explanation: The passage says 'she had very little food in the house'.

questions.text: The officer and the family had a very good dinner that evening .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'there was a lot of very good food on the table'.

questions.text: The lady was surprised to see her Chinese cook so good at cooking .
questions.explanation: The lady was surprised because the food appeared so quickly, not because of the cook's skill.

questions.text: In fact , the Chinese officer just had his own food in the lady's house .
questions.explanation: The cook brought the officer's dinner from his own house.

question_sets.context: One day a shark(鲨鱼)met a monkey. The shark said, "Hello! My friend. Would you please come to my house? My mother and the others in my family want to see you. We talk so much about you every day, but we never see you." "It's very kind of you, " the monkey said, "but you see I can't swim. How can I get there?" "Oh, it's easy. You can sit on my back. I'll carry you there." The monkey sat on the shark's back and they started out. On the way the shark said, "I must tell you that my mother is ill. She will be well again if she eats your heart. That's why I bring you here." "But I'm sorry. I forgot to bring my heart with me. Carry me back for it." The monkey said. When they returned, the monkey climbed up the tree and kept the shark waiting for him in the sea.

questions.text: The shark wanted to ask the monkey to visit his mother.
questions.explanation: The shark wants the monkey to visit his mother.

questions.text: The shark's mother wanted to eat the monkey's heart.
questions.explanation: The shark's mother wanted to eat the monkey's heart.

questions.text: The monkey was not clever.
questions.explanation: The monkey was clever.

questions.text: The shark didn't get the heart of the monkey at last.
questions.explanation: The shark didn't get the heart of the monkey at last.

questions.text: The monkey climbed up the tree and got his heart for the shark's mother.
questions.explanation: The monkey climbed up the tree and didn't get his heart for the shark's mother.

question_sets.context:
Helen: Wake up, Patrick! Lessons start in a minute!
Patrick: It's OK, Dad. I don't have to get up early today.
Helen: Patrick! It's me, not your dad!
Patrick: What? Oh, Helen. I'm tired. I have to get up at 6:30 to do my paper round.
Helen: Do you do a paper round? I didn't know that.
Patrick: I'm saving money. I want to buy a computer. I need it for Green Line.
Helen: Why do you have to buy a computer? Why don't the Green Line people pay for one?
Patrick: Well, they've given me some money, but it's not enough.
Helen: I've written an article for Green Line. Would you like to look at it?
Patrick: Sure, but I have to read these adverts first. I'm looking for a weekend job.
Helen: Patrick, you don't have to do all this work. Why don't you phone Shane and talk to him?
Patrick: That's a good idea. I might do that.

questions.text: At first, Patrick thinks Helen is his mother.
questions.explanation: In the passage, Patrick says 'It's OK, Dad.' So, he thinks Helen is his father, not his mother.

questions.text: Patrick's tired because he's been on holiday.
questions.explanation: Patrick is tired because he has to get up at 6:30 to do his paper round.

questions.text: Patrick gets up early in the morning.
questions.explanation: Patrick gets up at 6:30 in the morning to do his paper round.

questions.text: Patrick goes to bed at ten o'clock.
questions.explanation: The passage does not mention what time Patrick goes to bed.

questions.text: Patrick wants to buy a computer.
questions.explanation: Patrick wants to buy a computer for Green Line.

questions.text: Patrick earns ￡10 a week.
questions.explanation: The passage does not mention how much Patrick earns a week.

question_sets.context:
One day mother looked at Nick's shoes and said, "Nick, look at your shoes. How dirty they are! You must clean them."
"Oh, mother, but I cleaned them only yesterday," said the boy.
"They are dirty now. You must clean them again."
"I don't want to clean them today. Even if (即使) I clean them today, they will be dirty again tomorrow."
Nick's mother thought for a moment and said: "All right, don't do it then."
In the evening, Nick came back from school. He was very hungry.
"Mother, give me something to eat, please," he said.
"You had your breakfast in the house, Nick, and you had lunch at school," his mother said.
"I am hungry again," cried the boy.
"Oh, hungry? But if I give you something to eat today. You will be hungry again tomorrow."

questions.text: One day mother looked at Nick's clean shoes and she was very happy.
questions.explanation: The passage said Nick's shoes were dirty, not clean.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: Nick wanted to do his homework first after school when he got home.
questions.explanation: The passage said Nick was hungry when he got home.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: Nick was not hungry at all because he had lunch at school.
questions.explanation: The passage said Nick was hungry again.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

questions.text: Nick was very polite(礼貌) to his mother.
questions.explanation: Nick complained about cleaning his shoes and asked for food.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Tone & Attitude

questions.text: Nick's mother didn't give him something to eat when he cried.
questions.explanation: Nick's mother said if she gave him something to eat today, he would be hungry again tomorrow.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Fact vs. Opinion; Supporting Details

question_sets.context: Nan Di lives in a city in the north. He wants to visit some places in the south, but he doesn't want to spend too much money. This summer he has a short vacation. He decides to take a trip(旅游) to Hainan. He talks to a friend about his plan. His friend says,"It's a long journey(旅程). If you go by plane, you'll get there in a few hours. Then you'll have more time for sightseeing. If you go by train, it'll take you four or five days to get there." He leaves in the middle of June and gets back to work at the end of the month. It takes him more than two weeks to make the trip. What is the matter? He goes by ship for most of the journey.

questions.text: Han Di lives in a city in the south.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Nan Di lives in a city in the north.

questions.text: He has a short vacation this summer.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "This summer he has a short vacation."

questions.text: The trip to the south takes him more than two weeks.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that "It takes him more than two weeks to make the trip."

questions.text: He comes back in June.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "He leaves in the middle of June and gets back to work at the end of the month."

questions.text: It'll take a few days to travel from the north to the south .
questions.explanation: The friend said it would take four or five days by train, not a few days in general.
